Job Details
Position Title: Global Human Resources Business Partner (Bio/Pharmaceuticals Industry) - Associate Director / Director Level
Location: Cambridge, MA 02139
Duration: 12+ months of contract to start
Client: Leading Biopharmaceutical Company
Job Responsibilities:
Position Overview:

Reporting to the Head of Human Resources for Global Oncology Business Unit, the Associate Director / Director, HR Business Partner will support Oncology’s Commercial organization, and partner closely with, and be a trusted advisor to, commercial leaders. The incumbent will demonstrate strong business acumen, a desire to deeply understand the business, and deep and broad human resources functional knowledge.

Key Responsibilities:

• HR Strategy and Tactics: Develop and execute the HR strategic plan and align people management actions to support business objectives. Translate complex business plans into actionable people plans.

• Talent Management: Partner closely with business leaders to drive and champion effective talent management strategies, inclusive of performance management, talent review, succession planning, development plans, leadership development, global development programs and overall talent development.

• Business Acumen: Have a keen interest in understanding the business deeply and broadly. Partner with a business orientation. Proactively seek to expand HR knowledge and expertise.

• Business Partnership: Build and foster strong, high challenge, and high support relationships with commercial leadership team and key senior stakeholders. Establish credibility, be a trusted advisor and serve as a consultative, collaborative and engaged business partner – helping to resolve business issues and drive organizational effectiveness.

• Coach & Motivator: Foster the professional growth of others through knowledge sharing, professional and personal counseling, personal attention and effort.

• Organizational Design: Improve client group efficiency and effectiveness through the alignment of organizational structures with the strategic objectives of the business.

• Lead Change: Proactively evaluates, promotes, initiates and drives change that creates value for patients, the organization, and our shareholders. Develop Change Agents.

• Employer of Choice: Partner with other BUs and Functions to ensure that the EVP is appropriately leveraged to attract top talent to the Oncology BU. Implement initiative to address ongoing Best-in-Class Employee Survey feedback.

Professional Experience:
The Associate Director / Director, HR Business Partner, must be a strategic, proactive, agile and creative business partner with proven experience working in a dynamic and fast paced company. The incumbent must have the passion, energy and intellectual capacity required to support a dynamic commercial organization. Prior experience in the life sciences is highly desired as is past experience supporting a sales and/or commercial organization which includes sales, marketing, market access, operations, etc. Global experience is also highly desired
Minimum requirements:
A bachelor’s degree in human resources, business administration, or a related field with a strong preference for an advanced degree.
10+ years of human resources experience with a career progression of increasing responsibility
Prior experience supporting a sales and/or commercial organization in a life sciences organization \The ability to effectively lead through influence and persuasion complimented by the ability to push back on and challenge stakeholders
Excellent project management, time management and creative problem-solving skills
Minimum requirements (cont’d):
Broad and deep knowledge of HR policies and practices Strong communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact with people at all levels of an organization
A proactive, creative and motivated, self-starter with a strong work ethic based in a desire to always tackle and overcome obstacles
Change management experience
The ability to apply establish analytical skills to identify critical issues and determine possible solutions
Strong leadership presence and polished demeanor
Strong drive for performance and sense of urgency
Strong commercial and analytical skills rior experience with the design of sales incentive programs and working with commercial business analytics highly desired
Qualifications
A bachelor’s degree in human resources, business administration, or a related field with a strong preference for an advanced degree.
Life Sciences Industry (Pharmaceuticals/Oncology is Ideally what we are looking for)
10+ years of human resources experience with a career progression of increasing responsibility
Prior experience supporting a sales and/or commercial organization in a life sciences organization \The ability to effectively lead through influence and persuasion complimented by the ability to push back on and challenge stakeholders
Excellent project management, time management and creative problem-solving skills
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Job Title: Global Human Resources Business Partner (Bio/Pharmaceuticals Industry)

Job Description:
THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS OF BROOKLINE, MASSACHUSETTS

Job Description for:

Human Resources Generalist

The Human Resources Assistant for the Public Schools of Brookline will be responsible for performing a variety of administrative and human resources functions including but not limited to supporting the hiring process for all benefited positions, preparing letters and hiring documents, assisting with the maintenance of employee files, attendance records, and providing general office support and customer service. The position reports to the Director of Human Resources and will directly assist and act in a confidential capacity to persons otherwise excluded from coverage under MGL chapter 150E.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Process all CORI for new employees, current employees, parents, and volunteers.
Download and maintain SAFIS results data in a spreadsheet. Provides suitability determination letters to other school districts as necessary.
Maintain and monitor data input of CORIs in Excel, MUNIS and X2.
Communicate clearance of CORIs and SAFIS to corresponding hiring managers, secretaries, and after school directors.
Assist with reviewing lane changes and process paperwork when complete.
Provides front line customer service for the Human Resources Office, answers telephones, distributes mail, schedules meetings, maintains filing system, orders supplies, prepares memorandum, and provides additional administrative and/or project specific support to the Director of Human Resources and the Human Resources Office.
Assists with the hiring process. Trains employees on hiring policies and procedures, tracks applicants, advertises positions, updates websites. May set up interviews, review interview questions, and acknowledge applicants. May serve as the HR liaison to searches.
Provides superior customer service and recruitment support including assisting staff, managers and outside customers who call and/or visit the Human Resources office.
Assists with processing for new hires and terminated employees including preparing personnel requisitions, job postings, completion of new hire/termination paperwork and payroll related paperwork. Tracks required documentation for prospective employees. Ensures required documentation has been submitted prior to employee start date.
Maintains employee files both manual and automated according to instructions outlined by the Director and/or applicable federal and state laws.
Assists management by handling confidential information as it relates to matters of collective bargaining, employee discipline, and benefits and leave administration.
Assists with the distribution and tracking of probationary and annual employee evaluations for non-teaching positions.
Responsible for producing human resources-related reports to include applicant tracking, performance evaluation tracking, and completion of surveys.
Assists with administering the new hire orientation program and any other training activities of the department.
Assists in the maintenance of a human resources/payroll information system (occasionally assists with the payroll support as requested by the Director of Human Resources).
Works in a collegial and collaborative manner with co-workers.
Assist with coordination of search committees for various positions
Distribute mail to the Human Resources department personnel.
Record State Ethics completion in MUNIS.
Process address changes in MUNIS requested by employees.
Monitor Human Resource’s Budget and process invoices through MUNIS.
Process Account Payable, reimbursement and department supply order.
Performs other duties as assigned by the Director of Human Resources.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or appropriate combination of education and experience.
The successful candidate must have strong written and oral communication skills, as well as the ability to handle multiple tasks in a highly interactive environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills, organizational, and problem solving skills are also required.
Must possess proficient knowledge of word processing programs, database management, and spreadsheet software.

Preferred Qualifications:

A minimum of three (3) years human resource or related experience strongly preferred.
Experience working in a human resources office or similar office environment preferred.
Experience with MUNIS or other human resources data systems, applicant tracking and payroll software preferred.

When you're part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you'll be supported in achieving your career goals.

Division Specific Information
The Director, HR Business Partner, will serve as the Strategic HR liaison for the Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient (API) global business unit and will be responsible for developing HR strategies globally and managing all aspects of Human Resources for a full P&L business. This position will lead and manage business unit wide Talent initiatives, Change management efforts, Organizational development and provide Functional HR business partnership across six sites in North America and Europe.

As the HR Business Partner, this person will work effectively across a highly global matrixed environment, engaging and aligning with business leaders, HR field teams in multiple countries, and HR centers of excellence (COE) to identify gaps and opportunities, and together develop the go-forward winning solutions. The HR Business Partner will be part of the Business Unit Senior Leadership team and the HR Division Leadership team. As such, the role will include supporting certain Division wide initiatives and/or clients as needed.

How will you make an impact?

As a trusted advisor to the business, the HR Business Partner will translate business strategy and objectives into goals and workforce plan in alignment with business imperatives (talent management, organizational development, performance management, career development, employee relations, compensation planning and change leadership). The incumbent will demonstrate learning and leadership agility, showing a curiosity and passion the mission, setting priorities and taking action in an organized, proactive manner.

What will you do?
Facilitates organizational diagnosis and metrics to drive organizational effectiveness through talent and organizational capabilities and culture. Acts as a catalyst for change; guides and directs organizational design, development and change management solutions.
Develop a solid strategic human resource plan to support and drive the needs of the business; including attracting, developing and retaining top talent including opportunities for process improvements.
Keeps abreast of CDMO industry market trends as well as and functional trends, and leverages these insights to develop appropriate global HR solutions.
Coaches senior leaders on complex leadership and HR issues including development and talent performance and issues which could have the potential to create a competitive advantage for the business.
Act as a change agent and lead key change management initiatives for the business. Participate in the broader division and group HR team to drive HR projects and initiatives.
Partner with site, HR and Business leaders to oversee and provide guidance on activities, shape culture and drive employee engagement.
Perform other duties as assigned including Group and Division talent initiatives, projects and programs.
How will you get here?
Education
Bachelor's degree in Business, HR or related field is required. A strong aptitude for business and financial acumen is highly recommended.
Experience
8-10 years of progressive experience in all aspects of Human Resources and as a HR Business Partner who has supported global clients.
Experience as the lead HR Business Partner for a full P&L business and experience supporting multiple manufacturing operations (or substantial non-exempt population) strongly preferred.
Experience successfully operating in a highly matrix organization environment. Ability to execute and influence across geographic/functional lines around the world.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Demonstrated experience in developing strategic solutions, yet able to plan, implement at execute locally to drive and deliver business results.
Ability to organize detailed data into information, communicate the business story, and explain data for varying audiences in a concise manner.
Proven consultative HR experience, with a strong bias for action and results.
Ability to execute and influence across geographic/functional lines and work within a global matrixed model.
Ability to gain trust, respect, and support through business knowledge and functional competence.
Willingness and ability to travel globally at least 25% - 35% of the time.
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission-enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Andrew House, a program of Bay Cove Human Services is an acute treatment facility providing medically monitored services to adults who need short-term detoxification from alcohol, heroin and other opiates We are seeking a dynamic and talented Nurse Manager.
The Nurse Manager is responsible for managing the daily operations and nursing care in line with clinical practice standards of the unit The Nurse Manager is responsible for Nursing staff and related medical support staff including RNs and LPNs
Responsibilities:
Oversees clinical nursing care, ensuring compliance with established regulations and standards including quality assurance, confidentiality, and medical record documentation.
Provides direct supervision to nurses and subordinate staff, ensuring appropriate assessment and treatment of patient health.
Serves as key problem-solving resource for staff on patient issues.
Studies patient needs/trends and suggests solutions to ongoing patient care problems.
Compiles/analyzes data on patient outcomes, quality assurance results, budget/goal achievement, and performance/productivity and prepares reports for administration.
Participates in team planning related to clinic and emergency/disaster response system.
Conducts performance review meetings, regularly provides feedback and coaching and is responsible for the overall development and succession planning of the staff Act as house coverage/rotation when required Collaborates with other disciplines to affect positive patient outcomes.
Qualifications: *
5 years of professional nursing experience 2 years supervisory-level experience preferred Current state MA license.
Current CPR certificate Experience working with the following populations: dual diagnosis, substance use disorder, and homelessness Knowledge of budgetary, supervisory, human resources, and quality-improvement principles and techniques.
Knowledge of principles of employee development to ensure appropriate training and mentoring of staff.
Skill in applying and modifying, as appropriate, the principles, methods, and techniques of professional nursing.
Skill in identifying problems, researching, and recommending solutions.
Skill in developing and maintaining high level of quality care/quality assurance.
Ability to manage the overall provision of nursing services and build consensus among staff.
Keywords: Nurse, Nursing, Nurse Manager, Healthcare, Human Services, Substance Abuse, Detox, ATS, Clinical, Medical, Supervisor, Nonprofit, Human Services, Recovery
Driving License Required
Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
Dental insurance
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Employee discount
Flexible schedule
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Referral program
Retirement plan
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
Nursing: 5 years (Required)
Supervisory: 2 years (Required)
substance abuse, homelessness: 2 years (Preferred)
License:
Registered Nurse (RN) (Preferred)
Work Remotely:
No

Job Title: Produce Manager

Department: Operations

Reports To: Store Manager/ Assistant Store Manager

We are living our Mission; “The Price Rite Way, Our Messaging to Customers” which states:

“At Price Rite, we have created a different type of shopping experience, designed to give the customer the best combination of value, selection and service, and all with the customer in mind. We call it the Rite Way and it is the mission we live by:
The Price Rite Values- Provide you with inconceivably, incredibly low prices every day, along with an array of “special buys”- better than clubs, full-service and small box competitors.
The Price Rite Selection- Offer the freshest range of produce, meats, dairy, and baked goods along with leading brands in every category. We supplement this with our amazing private brand program, which proudly carries the Price Rite name.
The Price Rite Service- Enthusiastic, friendly and local customer service in every department and at check-out, all accessible to you and happy to help.
We want to change the way you shop, we want you to love our experience, and always want to hear how we can get better. Thanks for choosing the Rite Way.

The RITE Way guides everything we do and is why we are in business. At price Rite, we know that a cohesive team is the foundation for everything we try to do as a company. Team Members are our “front line” to the customer, and our key partner in delivering the RITE Values, providing the RITE Service, and the RITE Selection every day.

Job Summary

The Produce Manager is accountable to the Store Manager/ Assistant Store Manager and is responsible in the Produce department for maximizing sales, protection of company assets, store conditions, presentation, control of losses, and contributes to the company's operating objectives.

Minimum Required Qualifications:

The minimum required qualifications for this position include, but are not limited to, the following:

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions:

Associate's degree (A. A.) from two-year college or university; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or associates of organization.
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume.
Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.
Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Ability to regularly stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and talk or hear; sit and taste or smell; frequently lift and/or move certain objects.
Specific vision requirements for this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the associate is occasionally exposed to outside weather conditions as well as cold to hot temperatures.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Essential Job Functions:

Performance of the essential functions of this position require the Team Member to possess the minimum qualifications listed above. These functions include, but are not limited to, the following:

Manages, supervises and provides leadership to 10-15team members in the store.
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training associates; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining associates; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
Maintains store conditions per company standard to improve profitability.
Maximizes department sales and profits.
Develops and maintains a team concept to improve associate morale, communications, non-union status, working conditions.
Maximizes store profits and gross profit through effective merchandising.
Achieves or surpasses productivity and payroll goals in each department.
Maintains customer service levels according to company standards.
Complies with company and governmental sanitation standards.
Ensures weekly on-hand inventory goals through proper ordering practices.
Manages the recruitment, development, training and counseling of all associates.
Manages others and adhere to company human resource and personnel policies as well as state and federal laws.
Establish a working relationship with all support staff and supervisors.
Develop a daily/weekly workload plan, coordinate responsibilities and follow through to maximize results.
Executes merchandising directives.
Ensures proper maintenance and safe use of equipment.
Ensure proper usage compliance and handling of all supplies.
Responsible for opening or closing store, where applicable.
Establish community involvement.
Has a Company recognized Food Safety Certification and/ or can successfully complete training to receive and maintain a Company recognized Food Safety Certification

Important Disclaimer Notice: The above statements are only intended to represent the essential job functions and general nature of the work being performed and are not exhaustive of the tasks that an Associate may be required to perform. The employer reserves the right to revise this job description at any time and to require Associates to perform other tasks as circumstances or conditions of its business, competitive considerations, or the work environment change. This job description is not a guarantee of employment.

**Please attach a Resume and Cover letter***
The Boston Public Health Commission (BPHC) Office of Human Resources (OHR) provides the human resources and payroll functions and services to approximately 1,150 BPHC employees. This includes recruiting and retention, benefits, employee relations, payroll and oversight of policies and procedures. The Associate Director will report to the Director and will assist the Director in providing leadership and direction to the day-to-day operations of the OHR. Specifically, the Associate Director will perform the following duties:

Assists Human Resources Director and staff in processing and working on projects related to benefits, leaves of absences, workers comp, recruiting/staffing, reporting, presentations, policies and procedures, accommodations, and payroll.
Supports BPHC's commitment to equal employment opportunity and the development of a diverse workforce.
Oversees and coordinates the distribution and tracking of new policies/procedures, information materials, annual flu vaccine requirement, annual residency requirement.
Ensures consistent and equitable application of policies.
Provides leadership in the change process, by influencing, championing, and assisting department and organizational change initiatives.
Ensures compliance and consistency with BPHC employee policies and procedures and is responsible for monitoring the Commission's sick leave policy.
Gathers, develops, tracks, reviews, and analyzes data and reports.
Assists the Director with Performance Management.
Assists with the development/implementation and administration of staff training on specific provisions of the BPHC policies and benefits programs.
Provides coverage for when staff are out of the office.
Works on special projects as assigned by the Director.
Represents the department and serves as a resource by participating on various committees and attending meetings as necessary.
Participates as a representative of HR in the Commission's Strategic Planning.
Work in a confidential capacity with the Human Resources Director and the Office of Labor and Employment. Use independent judgment and discretion to make decisions. May represent management in grievance and arbitration process, including but not limited to hearing and resolving grievances, and attending grievance and arbitration hearings.
Identifies potential problems in the areas of employee performance, time and attendance, interpretation and implementation of policies and resolves and/or recommends solutions including the appropriate course of action.
Works with Managers on corrective action; assist in developing and reviewing supporting documentation, disciplinary notices, and performance improvement plans.
Assists with workplace investigations, documentation, quarterly reports, and corrective action plans.
Represents the Commission at unemployment hearings.
Attends employee disciplinary hearings as hearing officer or presenter and writes hearing reports as required.
Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local legal requirements.
Reviews accommodation requests and coordinates appropriate follow-up.
Additional duties as assigned.
**Please attach a Resume and Cover letter***
Minimum Qualifications

Education and Experience

BA/BS with 7 plus years' experience in a generalist or HR Manager role performing the functions listed above. Significant human resources generalist or related experience may be substituted for part or all the degree requirements.
Preferred but not required: Master's degree in HR, Business Administration or related field plus 5 or more years' experience as an HR Generalist, or related experience, OR
Certification of SPHR or SHRM-SCP preferred.
Certification and/or experience in Anti-Discrimination, Harassment and Retaliation training and investigating, preferred.
Human resources experience in a public unionized environment.

Knowledge, skills and abilities:

Experience dealing with employee relations and mediation.
Effective interpersonal skills at all levels of management.
Strong working experience of ADP system.
Strong oral and written communication skills; strong presentation skills required.
Ability to make decisions in a variety of situations.
Sound judgment, discretion, and integrity.
Teamwork skills, ability to respond to inquiries or complaints.
Strong organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to understand and interpret policies.
Experience working effectively with diverse groups.
Prior supervisory experience required.
Additional Information
City of Boston Residency Required, A Criminal Offenders Records Information request must be completed for this position. However, a record is not an automatic bar to employment but is reviewed in relation to the job applied for., Any position that requires an advanced degree will be subject to education verification, The Boston Public Health Commission is an EEO Employer and all applicants meeting the minimum requirements are eligible to apply, The advertised shift and schedule are subject to change at the departments discretion.

Ready to be a LEADER in a GROWING Organization? Ocean State Job Lot is hiring for Store Leadership in the Rockland, MA area! Check out our website to apply, oceanstatejoblot.com/careers-store-leadership
Who YOU are: A leader with at least 2 years of Retail Management experience that has a passion for delivering results while building and motivating a high performing team! Not only are you a leader that is looking to bring YOUR passion to OUR mission, but a LEADER that is looking to develop themselves along with a team while creating a fun yet exciting experience for our customers.
Who WE are: Ocean State Job Lot, an organization that has been voted Best Mid Sized Employer. We are inspired every single day to not only contribute to the communities where we live and work, but to help build careers at the same time. We believe that the real value and long term success of our business comes from our associates. Ocean State Job Lot is the Northeast's largest, privately held, closeout retail chain with 140 stores (and counting!) in New England, New York, and New Jersey, and Pennsylvania with approximately 5,600 employees, and annual sales exceeding $650 million.
The Opportunity: The Store Leadership Team is responsible to lead a team of associates in the timely and consistent execution of all Merchandising, Operational, and Human Resource policies and procedures within a designated retail location in accordance with the philosophy and standards of the company.Upon joining our Leadership team, Leaders are given an extensive hands on training which will prepare and provide you with the knowledge, tools and confidence to run a store while growing your career at the same time! Be part of our success and join our Leadership team!

Please note this position will be supporting the North America Sort Center (NASC) network.

•Leader must be willing to support the 24/7 environment.

Are you a seasoned HR leader that is adventurous, innovative, able to move at the speed of light, and interested in using your HR skills to help evolve the way we serve our customers? Are you interested in being part of an HR organization that operates as a business, starts with our customers and works backward to deliver meaningful products to our business? Are you passionate about changing customer's lives for the better? Are you passionate about leading and developing a team of HR professionals? If this sounds exciting to you, then consider joining us as an HR Business Partner II, BUSINESS in our Worldwide Operations HR team!
This role will partner with business leaders to develop and execute HR strategies focused on talent management, organizational effectiveness, workforce planning, and employee engagement. In addition, they will own programs that run across the broader HR team. To be successful in this role, you must understand business priorities and translate them into the highest impact work. You will help business leaders look around corners with data-driven recommendations that improve performance, retention, and the overall employee experience.
To succeed, you will need a flexible skill set, including the ability to think strategically, execute tactically, and collaborate across many teams, levels, and situations.
Additionally, successful candidates will demonstrate:
· The ability to lead, develop, and inspire a team of HR professionals in a high growth, rapidly changing environment
· Being an enthusiastic team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment
· The ability to be comfortable with high volume workload and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves"
· A strong solutions focus and be comfortable working in an environment which demands strong deliverables along with the ability to identify problems and drive appropriate solutions
· Strong internal and external customer service focus
· The ability to understand business goals and recommend new approaches, policies and procedures to effect continual improvements in business objectives, productivity and development of HR within the company
· Understand the entire talent system and each stage of the employee lifecycle and applies that understanding to craft integrated solutions that are thoughtful and reinforced by upstream and downstream talent programs
· Bias for action, strong work ethic, and desire to achieve excellence
· Must be able to interface at all levels of the organization
· Operates with autonomy and discretion.
· A true hands-on approach as well as the ability to successfully monitor the "pulse" of the employees to ensure a high level of employee engagement
· Experience with rapid and complex changing work environment ¡E Ability to support a 24/7 environment that has multiple shifts and a significant staffing ramp during our seasonal peak in the fourth quarter. Must be willing to work a flexible schedule that includes nights, weekends and holidays.
Success in this role will require influential partnership with middle and senior management within the organization to execute the HR strategies that foster organizational and people effectiveness. The individual in this role must understand business priorities and translate them into an HR agenda that supports the business as it grows.


Basic Qualifications

· Bachelor's Degree from accredited university
· 3+ years human resource business partner experience
· Experience supporting hourly employee client groups
· Experience in a call center, distribution center, or manufacturing environment

Preferred Qualifications

· Master's Degree or MBA in HRM preferred
· Proficiency with HRIS System
· Human Resources experience with Fortune 500 companies supporting 250-500 or more associates

*Amazon Operations and Distribution is a 24/7 environment and shifts may change due to business needs. Full shift flexibility including holidays, nights and weekends is needed for this role.

Markforged is reinventing manufacturing with the most affordable 3D metal and carbon fiber printers capable of producing parts strong enough for the factory floor. Engineers, designers, and manufacturing professionals all over the world rely on Markforged metal and composite printers for tooling, fixtures, functional prototyping, and high-value end-use production and optimizing their manufacturing and supply chains. Founded in 2013 and based in Watertown, MA, Markforged has about 250 employees globally, with $137 million in both strategic and venture capital. Markforged’s vision is a world in which you build anything you imagine. Markforged was recently recognized by Forbes in the Next Billion-Dollar Startups list and listed as the fastest-growing 3D printing company in the US in the 2019 Deloitte Fast 500. Desire, drive and ambition to make an impact and get results

Job Summary

Under direction of the Sr. Manager Agile Enablement CoE, the Sr Program Manager is responsible for supporting the strategy and successful execution of THP’s transition to an Agile / Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) development organization. The Sr. Manager Agile Enablement manages the most complex, highest external visibility programs of the longest duration including THP’s Scaled Agile transformation program. He / She will be responsible for managing specific functions through the Agile transition using Scaled Agile Framework and Agile methods. This is a critical role that requires significant influence with leaders and key stakeholders to ensure Lean processes and structures are being adhered to as well as providing guidance on how to improve. This incumbent will advise and coach our leaders through new ways of working with a Lean Agile methodology. They will provide training to development resources for continuous delivery techniques. Development, implementation and changes to these programs are the most complex, contain the most risk to THP, and have the most cost to the organization and to business partners. The Sr. Program Manager must be able to conceptualize and envision the impact of change, and propose new ways to do business on behalf of the organization.

Job Description

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS* (in order of importance)

1. Overall program ownership and management key programs, focusing on both short-term initiatives and long-term strategic direction and objectives for the programs.
Management of business implementation project managers and cross-functional operations, processes, and workflows within Tufts HP that support and service the programs.
Proactive and solutions-oriented management of program operations and integration issues, requiring the ability conceptualize and envision the impact of change, and propose new ways to do business to better meet the needs of the client and Tufts HP
2. Highest level program manager for programs applying SAFe Agile experience and general project management expertise to ensure that workflows, processes, risks, communications, resources, and quality are managed appropriately within Tufts HP to support the client’s program and projects, at both the operational and corporate agenda level.
Determines needs and defines, plans and directs implementation plan including transformational roadmap for SAFe transition;
Identifies risk within the context of the broad project and accurately estimates and plans resource usage accordingly;
Ensures that Tufts HP’s established project management tools, processes, standards, and techniques are followed and defines new, adapted for SAFe based on knowledge of existing processes and tools ;
Exercises judgment to make decisions, or to raise issues to the appropriate level in a timely manner.
Evaluates the cost and feasibility of multiple options/alternatives to resolve project issues and to make recommendations on those issues that best meet both program and corporate Tufts HP objectives;
Manages project communications and interface with internal and external constituents to ensure that the program and project goals are met.
3. Leveraging her/his deep expertise with Agile principles and methods, large scale solution development and Organizational Change Management, the incumbent will work across business and IT to define and build consensus for the strategic roadmap, execution plan and funding levels required to manage the execution of this large change initiative. This program will effectively change the way THP develops and delivers solutions resulting in dramatically improving speed to market, IT quality and cost-efficiency gains.

4. Will work with key individuals from the organization to define changes required to existing processes in order to adapt the THP delivery methodology to the Lean SAFe best practices. Will work with the lead to identify the proposed changes and build overall strategy and solution to end-to-end development delivery in SAFe Agile

5. Responsible for building a Lean Portfolio Management (LPM) structure that will support the Value Streams with the appropriate funding to develop and maintain portfolio products and services through a single stream of budget prioritization. Will also measure key metrics across all value streams down to the scrum team level – throughput, velocity and production defects.

6. The incumbent will be involved with advising and coaching our senior leaders on the principles and behavior changes that must take place to propel the transition.

7. Support scaling up the Lean Center of Excellence and work with partners to be able to train and coach THP organization in agile principles and to move all of development to be a high-performing agile organization. As part of the agile training, s/he will support train development resources on test-driven development, DevOps and continuous delivery techniques. Ultimately s/he will enable all scrum teams to deliver continuous business value on demand to our end customers and clients.

Requirements

JOB QUALIFICATIONS: KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES

EDUCATION:(Minimum education & certifications required)
Requires a Bachelor’s Degree with a Master’s degree preferred
Certification in Agile and Scaled Agile Framework required
EXPERIENCE:(Years of experience)
10 or more year’s business or industry experience. 8 + years of program management experience, including leading the most cross -functional high-level initiatives.
Minimum 4+ years of experience in Agile or Scaled Agile experience (either working in Agile/SAFe environment or experience rolling out new to organization Agile methodology) Experience as a Scrum Master or RTE is desired
Experience in the domain of strategy or technology consulting is an advantage
Significant business process and program management experience related to the implementation of healthcare insurance business applications and products using industry-standard project and program management tools and techniques with established track record.
Experience with managing technical implementations, as well as deep knowledge of the SDLC (Systems Development Life Cycle)
A proven ability to meet deadlines is also required.
SKILL REQUIREMENTS:(Include interpersonal skills)
Ability to thrive in a matrix-management, hands-on environment that demands a consultative approach and solutions that span multiple environments in a business area.
Outstanding communication and relationship management skills required, including the ability to effectively manage difficult group dynamics to effectively reach a positive outcome; very strong situation leadership skills.
SAFE agile certification
Excellent human resource management skills, ability to oversee team of project managers as part of the overall program
Highly developed oral and written communication skills, ability to communicate with and influence internal and external constituents at all levels with confidence.
Highest level presentation skills including ability to interface and “sell” new programs and changes to existing programs to a broad range of internal and external contacts, as necessary. Ability to interact with confidence with external and Tufts HP senior management.
Advanced MS Office knowledge (MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Word)
Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions
Ability to work independently and produce proposed approaches, solutions, etc. starting from a high level idea
Ability to facilitate complex discussions and gain consensus amongst parties with different visions or opinions
Strong negotiating, influencing, and advocacy skills, ability to lead others both internally and externally to ensure the success of the program.
Ability to navigate political issues using advanced organizational (Tufts HP) knowledge.
Must be flexible and a proponent/champion of change, able to conceptualize and envision the impact of change, and propose new ways to do business.
Must be an accomplished multi-disciplinary team-leader and team-builder with hands-on style. Ability to lead teams whose members have diverse professional and educational backgrounds, and to effectively manage difficult group dynamics to effectively reach a positive outcome.
Ability to balance strong leadership on day-to-day program management and significant issues while also aligning with program director’s broader needs and vision for the program.
Ability to present technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding.
Requires the ability to maintain effective and productive peer relationships. Must have the ability to motivate fellow employees by fostering team spirit, an attitude of cooperation, and a commitment to the organization. Requires well-developed interpersonal skills to act in the capacity of liaison to the user community.
Possess strong influencing and situational leadership skills with the ability to manage and motivate both direct and non-direct reports. Must have a demonstrated ability to obtain the confidence and trust of non-reports, resulting in high commitment and cooperation.
WORKING CONDITIONS AND ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:(include special requirements, e.g., lifting, travel, overtime)
Fast-paced office environment handling multiple demands. Moderate use of telephone and extensive use of PC required.
Requires that the individual be organized while being readily adaptable to changes in work priorities.
Flexible hours permitted providing the needs of the organization are met.
May require occasional evening or weekend hours as the needs of the organization dictate.
May require occasional vendor site visits, or attendance at seminars.
What we build together changes our customer's health for the better. We are looking for talented and innovative people to join our team. Come join us!

When you're part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you'll be supported in achieving your career goals.

The Sr. Human Resources Manager will be based in Cambridge MA primarily support the Viral Vector Services Business reporting into the Field HR Organization.

How will you make an impact?

As a trusted advisor to the business and functional leaders, you will consult and take action in the areas of talent management, organizational development, performance management, career development, employee relations, and compensation planning and change leadership.

What will you do?
Translate strategic business plans into critical HR actions, programs, and initiatives.
Evaluate and advise client groups on programs or strategies that impact the attraction, motivation, development and retention of the people resources of the business.
Provide HR support and coaching to managers on HR policies and processes, people management, and career development.
Counsel and/or coach employees and managers regarding employee relations issues including performance management, facilitation of formal/informal investigations, and any resulting disciplinary actions.
Develop innovative approaches to broad organizational design issues that support long-term business goals.
Mentor other team members.
Ensure effective talent attraction and management including recruitment, assessment, and development.
Assist managers in assessing and identifying resources to meet employee training needs.
Drive effective compensation equity and planning processes for the assigned client group.
Lead HR initiatives and annual HR processes for assigned client group.
Act as a change agent and lead complex change management initiatives for the site and/or assigned client groups
Participate in the broader regional HR team to drive HR process improvement projects and initiatives.
Partner with site, HR, and Business leaders to oversee and provide guidance on site activities, shape culture, and drive employee engagement.
Perform other duties as assigned.
How will you get here?
Bachelor's degree in HR or related field is required.
Master's degree or MBA preferred.
Must have 7 or more years of experience in various aspects of human resources (staffing, compensation, employee relations and organizational development).
Knowledge and understanding of US labor and employment law and business partnering experience.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Strong process improvement orientation.
Strong analysis, problem solving, decision making, negotiating and influencing skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to interface with all levels of the organization including employee relations, coaching, communications and presentations, etc.
Ability to work within a diverse and cross-functional team.
Proven experience in proactive leadership and change management.
Ability to navigate a complex matrixed organization and adapt quickly to changing business needs.
Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality, work independently, multi-task, and follow up on projects and issues
Can effectively secure and leverage resources to get work done through both formal and informal channels
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 75,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission-enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Overview:

Transdev is the largest private sector operator of multiple modes of passenger transit in North America, providing bus, rail, paratransit, shuttle, sedan and taxi services. We manage over 200 transportation contracts for cities, transit authorities and airports, providing safe and sustainable mobility solutions. Our mission is to improve public transportation, to enhance quality of life and combat global warming. Assists unit leadership in the administration and communication of HR policies and procedures, and handling compliance issues.

Responsibilities:
Consults with management staff on human resource issues related to hiring, compensation, training and development, disciplinary actions and terminations.
Interprets and assists with the understanding of human resource policies and procedures.
Develops and revises job descriptions.
Coordinates the hiring process including outreach and sourcing activities, candidate screening and selection, conducting reference and background screenings, onboarding, and new employee set-up.
Assists with the administration and tracking of benefits and leaves of absence.
Processes unemployment claims.
Ensures all personnel records are accurately maintained including maintenance of proper records and documentation of required training, certifications, and compliance. Responds to requests for personnel records.
Generates monthly, quarterly, annual and ad hoc reports.
Conducts investigations into complaints related to policy and ethics violation, and employee relations concerns.
Provides administrative support to the unit management staff.
Maintains confidentiality of all information.
Performs other duties as required.
Qualifications:

Education, Licensing, and Certifications Required:

High school diploma or equivalent, such as GED.

Education, Licensing, and Certifications Preferred:

Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business or related field preferred.

Experience:.

A minimum of two (2) years of relevant human resource experience including recruiting, selection, and benefits administration required.

Skills and Knowledge Required:

Understanding of employment laws and regulations.
Working knowledge and proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Ability to read, understand, and interpret instructions, policies, and procedures.
Strong written and oral communication skills; strong presentation skills.
HRIS, ADP, and investigative experience preferred.

Travel requirement (as a percent): Frequent travel to meet the needs of the business

Pre-Employment Requirements:

Must submit to drug testing and a background check.

Compensation:

$55,000 - $60,000 per year plus benefits

Physical Requirements:

Must be able to work shifts or flexible work schedules as needed.
90% of work is accomplished indoors and in air conditioned or well ventilated facilities
Work is accomplished in an office or in a cubicle space equipped with a telephone and computer.
The employee is generally subjected to long periods spent sitting, typing, or looking at a computer screen.

Our Mission Securing the software that powers your world. At Veracode, we are focused on that mission every day. Veracode is recognized as a premier provider of SaaS-based application security solutions, transforming the way companies secure applications in today's software driven world. We provide our customers with a solid foundation on which to build security into their modern agile development processes.

Veracode, the leading application security business, helps organizations secure the software that powers their world. Veracode's SaaS platform and integrated solutions help security teams and software developers find and fix security-related defects at all points in the software development lifecycle, before they can be exploited by hackers. Their complete set of offerings help customers reduce the risk of data breaches, increase the speed of secure software delivery, meet compliance requirements, and cost effectively secure software assets- whether that's software they make, buy or sell.

Veracode serves more than 2,000 customers across a wide range of industries, including nearly one-third of the Fortune 100, three of the top four U.S. commercial banks and more than 20 of Forbes' 100 Most Valuable Brands.


Description

We seek an experienced HR Business Partner to support our growing business. This role partners with the business to deliver against HR initiatives, drive talent management activity and provide leadership coaching. This is an individual contributor, hands on role, reporting to the Chief Human Resources Officer.

Major Job Responsibilities:
Manages human resource programs for dedicated business units including recruitment, compensation, benefits, performance management and employee relations. Responds to employee inquiries regarding programs and process.
Identifies opportunities to improve organizational effectiveness and partner with business leaders to define and implement new operating structures, systems and processes.
Provides thought leadership and tools to help managers guide the organization through a high degree of growth and change including communication strategy, proactive needs assessment, team effectiveness, leadership development and change management.
Advises managers in the resolution of employee relations and employee performance issues. Conducts research and investigations as needed to support decision-making process.
Partners with the Talent Acquisition team on staffing strategies and acquisition of key talent.
Maintains the pulse of the employee population, advising on risks to engagement and employee morale, potential performance level impacts and change management efforts.
Provides policy interpretation, counseling and training for employees and managers on programs, policies and procedures.
Champions innovation by seeking and calling out new opportunities.
Provides insight through use of analytics to support data driven management decisions.
Remains aware of internal company environment, competitive environment, and market trends and developments within functional area. Applies knowledge and provides input to senior management to develop policies and procedures that affect departmental operations and may impact other functional areas.


Qualifications and Experience:
Bachelor's degree with strong academic credentials
7 years of experience in a Human Resources Generalist/Business Partner role, with preferred experience in working with customer facing teams.
Proven ability to work within constraints as well as challenge the status quo.
Strong business acumen: interest and knowledge of the business strategy, key financial and business drivers. Able to link HR initiatives to business needs.
Demonstrated project management skills with solid track record of driving and implementing HR initiatives independently.
Proven results orientation, creative problem solving, high quality decision making. Strong mind-set for continuous improvement to meet or exceed expectations.
Strong presentation, facilitation and mediation skills.
Strong knowledge of human resources practices and legislation including employee relations
Key Attributes and Capabilities:
Genuine interest, curiosity and passion for the business and HR
Courage to challenge and act as the conscience of the organization
High degree of emotional intelligence demonstrated through good judgement, intuition, self-awareness and awareness of others. Flexibility to adapt style and method based on what is needed.
Influences others: able to leverage personal credibility and interpersonal skills to help others make better decisions and positively impact outcomes. Ability to establish strong relationships at all levels, using a consultative and customer centric focus. Asserts own position and ideas with confidence and enthusiasm.
Change orientation: works effectively in the face of ambiguity, maintains a positive outlook in difficult situations, acts as a change agent.
Self-starter and comfortable at both an individual contributor level as well as supporting a wider team.
Being able to deal with complexity and reacting quickly. A 'can do' attitude.
Believes in continuous improvement and brings knowledge of best practice to help innovate or improve existing processes or approaches.
Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills and ability to deliver results on time.

We have fun together. We honor who we are and work hard to achieve our potential.

More About Working at Veracode:


Veracode, is a leader in helping organizations secure the software that powers their world. Veracode's SaaS platform and integrated solutions help security teams and software developers find and fix security-related defects at all points in the software development lifecycle, before they can be exploited by hackers. Our complete set of offerings help customers reduce the risk of data breaches, increase the speed of secure software delivery, meet compliance requirements, and cost effectively secure their software assets- whether that's software they make, buy or sell.

Veracode serves more than 1,400 customers across a wide range of industries, including nearly one-third of the Fortune 100, three of the top four U.S. commercial banks and more than 20 of Forbes' 100 Most Valuable Brands. Learn more at www.veracode.com, on the Veracode blog, on Twitter and in the Veracode Community.

At Veracode you'll have the opportunity to eliminate barriers for our customers and earn a competitive compensation and total rewards package all while pushing the boundaries of what's possible by collaborating with a diverse team of global innovators. In short, Veracode's fun, diverse, and fast-paced culture has put us on the map as one of the best employers in Information Technology.

We offer competitive salary, company-sponsored premium Medical/Prescription & Dental Plans, company-paid Holidays, Vacation, Anniversary Service and Sick Days, 401(k) Plan, Education/Training Reimbursement, Charitable Gift Program, Adoption Assistance Program.

We are equal opportunity employers. As such, it is our corporate policy to fill positions with qualified candidates regardless of the candidate's race, color, sex, age, religion, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, pregnancy, military status, veteran status or any other protected group status.

Job Title: Director Level Human Resources Business Partner

Job Description:
********************ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY DIRECTLY THROUGH THE CPCS iCIMS WEBSITE. IF YOU APPLY THROUGH MASS CAREERS AND DO NOT COMPLETE THE CPCS iCIMS APPLICATION, YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION. PLEASE USE THE FOLLOWING LINK TO APPLY (CUT AND PASTE INTO YOUR BROWSER IF THE EMBEDDED LINK DOES NOT WORK): https://careers-publiccounsel.icims.com/jobs/1776/hr-assistant-director-senior-hr-business-partner/job*****************

CPCS is seeking an experienced Human Resources professional to be the Assistant Director of Human Resources/Senior Business Partner. This position works as an integral HR Team member to develop and implement solutions designed to improve HR effectiveness and to address the needs of legal and operational units and the agency as a whole.

DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION MISSION STATEMENT

CPCS is committed to protecting the fundamental constitutional and human rights of its clients by providing zealous advocacy, community-oriented defense, and excellent representation. In fulfilling its mission, CPCS is committed to fostering diversity at all levels of the agency. We are dedicated to building a strong professional relationship with each of our clients, to understanding their diverse circumstances, and to meeting their needs. In striving always to achieve those goals, CPCS embraces diversity and inclusion as core values and is steadfast in our commitment to: (1) ensuring that CPCS management and staff members represent a broad range of human difference and experience; (2) providing a work climate that is respectful and that supports success; and (3) promoting the dignity and well-being of all staff members. CPCS's leadership is responsible for ensuring excellence, diversity, and inclusion. Our ability to achieve these goals depends on the efforts of all of us.

AGENCY OVERVIEW

CPCS is the state agency in Massachusetts responsible for providing an attorney when the state or federal constitution or a state statute requires the appointment of an attorney for a person who cannot afford to retain one. The agency provides representation in criminal, delinquency, youthful offender, child welfare, guardianship, mental health, sexually dangerous person, and sex offender registry cases, as well as in appeals and post-conviction and post-judgment proceedings related to those matters.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The Assistant Director of Human Resources/Senior Business Partner contributes to CPCS’s mission by providing tactical and strategic consulting on HR strategies and practices that support the zealous representation of indigent clients across the Agency. This position serves as a coach to assigned managers on a broad variety of HR issues and assists them in understanding HR policies, systems, and management best practices. In addition, the Assistant Director of Human Resources/Senior Business Partner works as an integral HR Team member to develop and implement solutions designed to improve HR effectiveness and to address the needs of legal and operational units and the agency as a whole. In consultation with the Director of Human Resources Management, the Assistant Director also partners with Senior Management Team (SMT) members to align CPCS’s HR strategy with its mission, organizational goals, and strategic plans. The successful candidate will demonstrate a capacity to act as a successful and positive champion and agent for organizational change and transformation within HR and CPCS. This position reports directly to the Director of Human Resources Management and works in partnership with another Assistant Director of Human Resources/Senior Business Partner.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Works in partnership with legal and operational managers and provides them day-to-day consultation, coaching, and management support in a variety of areas, including employee on-boarding, training, development, and retention; work relationships, workplace atmosphere, and employee morale; staffing needs and workforce and succession planning; compensation and classification; policy interpretation and application; complaint investigation and conflict resolution; performance management; employee relations and discipline; strategic planning; and organizational design. In this capacity, the Assistant Director of Human Resources/Senior Business Partner meets regularly with assigned managers and units, develops and maintains trusted relationships with them, and recommends actions designed to address sensitive and complex situations.
Acts as a change agent for CPCS by analyzing and improving the design and implementation of CPCS’s HR processes and strategies and striving to develop and ensure best practices in our HR systems that support organizational change and transformation. The Assistant Director of Human Resources/Senior Business Partner works collaboratively with HR colleagues to ensure recruitment, hiring, and other HR functions are effective and efficient; provides project leadership for human resource initiatives and mentorship to less experienced human resource professionals; and actively participates in HR department meetings.
Analyzes organizational trends and metrics in partnership with colleagues in HR, IT, Finance, and the legal practice divisions in order to develop and implement measurable solutions that address challenges and complex issues, such as employee satisfaction, attrition, and retention; and evaluation and performance management.
Provides guidance and input on proposed changes to division or operational structures or staffing patterns, ensuring that core HR processes are applied appropriately and in a legally compliant manner.
Works with the Training Department to develop, implement, and evaluate skills and leadership training programs designed to ensure employee success.
Maintains an in-depth knowledge of the policy and legal requirements related to the day-to-day management of CPCS employees in order to reduce legal risk, guarantee regulatory compliance, and, most importantly, improve employee satisfaction and retention. Also oversees and manages complex employee-relations issues and provides information and support to legal counsel and managers during formal appeals and hearings.
MINIMUM ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or related field and seven years of progressively responsible experience in Human Resources, including at least three years in a managerial or direct supervisory capacity for an HR team/unit/department; or any equivalent combination of training, education, and experience that provides the required skills and knowledge. Proficiency in Office 2007 , Word, Excel, Power Point, and HRIS Systems is required.

A master’s degree in Human Resource Management is preferred, as is an HR certification, such as SHRM or PHR, and prior employee relations experience.

QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS

The successful applicant should have extensive knowledge and ability to apply HR regulations, industry trends, current practices, new developments, and applicable laws. Candidates must be able to thrive in an ambiguous and rapidly changing environment. Excellent interpersonal, communication, project management, problem solving, and organizational skills are needed for this role.

Other critical skills for this role are:
Business Acumen
Communication
Consultation
Ethical Practice
Cultural Awareness
Relationship Management
EEO Statement



The Committee for Public Counsel Services (CPCS) is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, sex, disability, religion, age, veteran or military status, genetic information, gender identity, or sexual orientation as required by Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, and other applicable federal and state statutes and organizational policies. Applicants who have questions about equal employment opportunity or who need reasonable accommodations can contact the Director of Human Resources Management, Lisa Bacon, at lbacon@publiccounsel.net

Job Title: HR Assistant Director/Senior HR Business Partner

Job Description:
If youre looking for a rewarding opportunity in a professional atmosphere, with incredible talent, and exciting potential, then Baker Newman Noyes is the place for you. BNN is committed to do the right thing, provide exceptional client service, care about others, win as a team, and our passion for learning and growth offers a one of a kind professional experience.

We are a regional firm with New England roots and a global reach, and we are looking to add Human Resources talent to our growing teams in NH and MA.

With over 250 employees throughout New England in Maine, Massachusetts, and New Hampshire, BNN provides expert accounting and tax services, healthcare consulting, and business and technology advisory services to a variety of clients with special focus on banking and financial services, healthcare, manufacturing and distribution, not-for-profit, public sector entities, privately held and family-owned businesses, and high net worth individuals. BNN is an independent member of Baker Tilly International.

BNN is looking for a team player with solid HR industry knowledge in NH & MA markets, likes to ask how can I help, and has experience in implementing and improving processes plus special interest in dashboard metrics, recruiting, managing FMLA, well-versed in NH & MA Employment Laws and 401k Profit Sharing administration to join our team.

Primary Function

In partnership with the Director of Human Resources and BNN leadership contribute to a positive image of BNN as a great place to work, support department specific goals and objectives by providing support in all related functions of recruiting, staffing, benefits, compensation, policy compliance, training, and work place culture.

Qualifications
Bachelor Degree preferred
HR Certificate (PHR, SHRM CP) preferred
3-5 years of HR generalist experience and demonstrated technical skill
Experience in a Professional environment preferred (i.e. certified public accounting firm, law firm)
Ability to achieve result through influence versus authority
Ability to report dashboard metrics
Excellent interpersonal, customer service and communications skills
Ability to handle sensitive information with extreme confidentiality
Facilitation and conflict management skills
Strong organizational and time management skills with high attention to details
Awareness of cross regional office culture and willingness to travel 50%.
This position will be based in Woburn, MA with travel to our offices in Boston, MA and Portsmouth, NH
Position Responsibilities
Provide continuous HR services primarily in NH and MA in supporting employee issues, address, support and resolve as necessary, escalating complex issues to Director of HR.
Operate with a high degree of independence and regularly demonstrate good judgment and discretion in solving problems and decision making. Make decisions based on standard operating procedures and policy.
Establish and maintain strong business partnerships with principals and employees to promote retention and employee satisfaction, including coaching sessions and 1:1 relationships.
Support recruitment efforts, on boarding and orientation in partnership and alignment with hiring manager to ensure delivery of related strategic initiatives and to attract, hire, and retain the best-qualified candidates.
Maintain current knowledge of all federal, state and local laws affecting human resources issues; make change recommendations to ensure compliance with all policies, practices and legal requirements and ethical procedures.
Coordinates all survey and reporting requirements with federal, state and local employment mandates. Provides metrics and data as needed.
Implement and administer company benefits programs, determine and track benefit eligibility, enrollment, and leave of absence administration. Provides service and support to employees with benefit issues.
Review policy procedures to ensure compliance with all processes and record keeping in accordance with firm practices. Responsible for the annual employee handbook update.
Serve as a liaison between employee and vendor partners to resolve benefit issues.
Conduct onboarding and benefit orientation process for all new employees and exit interviewing.
Participates with the Employee Recognition Committee, Womens Initiative and other firm sponsored initiatives, evaluate trending and influence innovative programs to support behavioral change.
Co -Facilitate annual training on sexual harassment, performance management, employee policy and procedures etc.
BNN strongly believes in maintaining a healthy balance between work and personal life. We support this through a variety of benefits, including:
20-30 days of vacation time
5 sick days
10 paid holidays
6-week paid parental leave
Health, Dental, Pet, Vision, Disability and Life Insurances
401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with company match
Baker Newman Noyes provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

To learn more, please visit our website, www.bnncpa.com

3.8
Job Description:
About The Executive Office of Technology Services and Security:

The Executive Office of Technology Services and Security (EOTSS) is the state’s lead office for information technology. We provide enterprise level information technology services including: network management and security; computer operations; application hosting; desktop provisioning and management; and, modern and responsive digital services to 40,000 internal stakeholders plus the residents, business owners and visitors to the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

The Mission:

The Executive Office of Technology and Security Services provides secure and quality digital information, services, and tools to customers and constituents when and where they need them.

The Role:

The Executive Office of Technology Services and Security (EOTSS) is seeking an experienced HR professional to collaborate with our managers to provide hands-on and strategic support in the areas of performance management and employee relations cultivating an effective, engaged and inclusive workforce.

The Employee Relations Manager will provide advice and guidance to employees and managers on a wide range of HR issues. He/She will coach and counsel employees and managers regarding employee relations issues, interface with union representatives on matters, collaborate with the HRD Centers of Expertise (COE) to manage employee relations cases, conduct investigations, guide conflict resolution, and engage in employee performance management and development.

Responsibilities and duties include, but are not limited to:

Assist Secretariat HR Director on a wide range of HR responsibilities including employee relations and retention, AA/EEO compliance, and labor relations.
Advise employees and managers on workplace matters, provide conflict resolution.
Advise and counsel managers on HR best practices on performance management
Advise and counsel managers on best practices and obligations on employee/labor relations
Lead the analysis of employee feedback and data, with the aim of creating an engaged and inclusive environment.
Recommend and implement initiatives and programs aimed at driving overall employee engagement
Coordinate communication sessions with managers and staff on a variety of topics/best practices
Proactively contribute to HR workforce initiatives, including workforce planning, performance management and staff development
Educate and inform managers and employees on employment laws and workplace policies
Review and make recommendations for the organization’s HR policies and procedures. Communicate updates and ensure compliance.
Participate in the management of the organization’s leaves of absence program.
Provide support and guidance to managers as it relates to contractual obligations
Provide support (coaching, counseling, education) to managers on employee relations and contractual obligations
Conduct workplace investigations and make recommendations on remedial measures

Qualifications

Preferred Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Minimum 5 years’ demonstrated experience as a human resources business partner.
Minimum 5 years’ demonstrated experience in a variety of human resource disciplines, including policy development and compliance, employee relations, diversity, performance management, and federal and state respective employment laws.
Experience working in a union environment.
Demonstrated strategic thinking, leadership capabilities, objective setting, and measurement skills.
Experience effectively coaching, delivering constructive feedback, inspiring and developing staff.
Ability to analyze and determine the applicability of program data, to draw conclusions, and to make appropriate recommendations.
Ability to persuade, influence and gain the buy-in of others.
Demonstrated ability to drive multiple projects to successful completion.
Ability to adjust to changing situations and be flexible to meet changing priorities.
Must maintain a high degree of professionalism and confidentiality.
HR professional certification(s) preferred.

MINIMUM ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS:

Applicants must have at least (A) six (6) years of full-time or, equivalent part-time, professional, administrative, supervisory, or managerial experience in business administration, business management, public administration, public management, clinical administration or clinical management of which (B) at least two (2) years must have been in a project management, supervisory or managerial capacity or (C) any equivalent combination of the required experience and substitutions below.

Substitutions:

I. A certificate in a relevant or related field may be substituted for one (1) year of the required (A) experience.

II. A Bachelor’s degree in a related field may be substituted for two (2) years of the required (A) experience.

III. A Graduate degree in a related field may be substituted for three (3) years of the required (A) experience.

IV. A Doctorate degree in a related field may be substituted for four (4) years of the required (A) experience.

An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.
