#LI-LW1
Job Title: Associate Director, HR Business Partner – G&A & Commercial

Job Description:
When you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll be part a growing organization that empowers our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. With our outstanding financial performance, leading market positions and the largest investment in innovation in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.

How will you make an impact?
We are excited to share that we have multiple roles reporting into a specific business in various locations. This role is integral to our commitment to advance and accelerate diversity and inclusion within our workplace, and specifically within the group assigned. Working within the robust matrix, this Director will ensure our workplace is representative of the communities and customers we serve and that the environment is inclusive for all. The incumbent must lead through influence not hierarchical power to drive cultural and behavior change and advancement of an inclusive culture. This role requires excellent change management skills and the ability to work effectively at all levels of the organization. The HR Director of Diversity and Inclusion will be the business group's subject matter expert and work collaboratively with the D&I CoE. Working with the business and HR broadly they will assess, determine and implement detailed and cohesive actions plan that aligns with the D&I CoE's strategic plans to yield measurable progress in specific workstreams, including but not limited to: recruiting and placement, ERG maximization, targeted development plans, retention, management cultural accountability, etc. The leader will have the responsibility to drive inclusion systematically across the business group, including deeper diagnostics, hypothesis creation and validation and defining key actions to drive appropriate change in support of our corporate goals.

What will you do?
Develops and delivers tailored best in class colleague inclusion and diversity roadmap that aligns with the D&I CoE's strategic plan and that positively and measurably affects the culture, team, and colleague experience in support of the business group's and company's strategic business goals.
Energizes and engages cross-functional and matrixed teams to achieve our vision, demonstrating a high-level of emotional intelligence, openness to change, and the willingness to merge ideas to bring forward the best solutions.
Provides expertise, thought leadership and best practices to D&I issues and opportunities, while operating as an extension of the D&I CoE.
Deliver a granular and comprehensive delivery plan for key priorities and interventions including increasing diversity representation within the leadership pipeline and delivering world class inclusion campaigns that deliver measurable progress on Diversity and Inclusion.
Act as the D&I subject matter expert, ensuring knowledge is relevant and up to date across multiple diversity and inclusion strands.
Work in collaboration with executive leaders, HR leadership, talent acquisition, talent management and head of D&I and others on identifying and minimizing the impact of any potential systematic barriers and enablers of diversity.
Work in partnership with the communications lead to ensure the communications of key messages and milestones that are aligned to the wider D&I strategic plan and roadmap.
How will you get here?
Bachelor's degree required
8-10 years of progressively responsible experience in Human Resources at a global organization, delivering inclusion, diversity or HR projects.
Ability to develop, analyze, and interpret data to drive systematic change and improvements
Strong understanding of the talent process and succession practices.
Proven ability to interact with multiple levels of leadership both internally and externally, and influence peers and senior management.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Strong communication skills- written and verbal; ability to present to and facilitate audiences at all levels.
Ability to travel as required for appropriate key meetings and forums (around 10% of the time).
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

Job ID: 003337


Company Name: NETSCOUT


Seeking a Senior Human Resources Business Partner based in Westford, MA

Description:

NETSCOUT SYSTEMS, INC. (NASDAQ: NTCT) is a market leader in real-time service assurance and cybersecurity solutions for today’s most demanding service provider, enterprise and government networks. We collect, correlate, organize, and analyze traffic data from all corners of your environment. Headquartered in Westford, Massachusetts, NetScout has approximately 2,500 employees and offices across the globe. NetScout serves the Global 5000 enterprise community as well as government agencies and telecommunications service providers.

Position Summary:

We are currently searching for a Senior Human Resources Business Partner based in Westford, MA to support the U.S. based Sales organization. Reporting to the Director Human Resources, Sales, the Senior HR Business Partner (HRBP) serves as a consultant to their client group, communicating needs proactively with our HR department and business management, to develop integrated solutions. The position formulates partnerships across the HR function to deliver value-added service to management and employees that reflects the business objectives of the organization.

Responsibilities:
Partner with our Domestic Sales organization leaders, employees and deliver HR support across multiple functions.
Act as the HR partner to provide coaching, counsel on HR policy, direction and support to our remote, home office-based Sales employees located in our domestic regions.
Works closely with management and employees to improve working relationships, engagement and retention
Partner with Talent Acquisition to support all aspects of the recruitment process.
Assists with coordination and facilitation of cyclical HR initiatives such as workforce planning, performance reviews and compensation planning.
Works closely with the HR Director to improve the overall effectiveness of the Sales Business Unit by building a talent and performance management culture that supports strategic business goals and links human capital to performance.
Partner with leaders to advise, counsel, and provide feedback to managers and employees on performance management, including the development and delivery of Performance Improvement Plans.
Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Partners with the legal department as needed/required.
Supports the rollout and execution of corporate HR programs and initiatives, participates in cross functional project teams.
Partners with Regional HR Colleagues and Corporate Centers of Expertise to provide best in class HR services to client groups.
Manage employee separations; conduct exit interviews; follow up on feedback as appropriate, track results and analyzes data.
Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough and objective investigations.
Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, or related field of study
PHR or SPHR certification preferred
6 to 8 years of progressive business partnership experience; experience supporting a global development organization preferred
Experience in technology industry a plus
Experience working with cross functional teams in a matrixed environment
Strong organizational skills, including the ability to multi-task under pressure and meet critical deadlines in a fast-moving environment
Demonstrated experience consulting with and advising business leaders
Accustomed to a customer focused, business partnering environment
Strong knowledge and practical application of Federal and State Employment Law & Legislation
Fully computer literate including Excel & PowerPoint at Intermediate level
High degree of problem solving abilities
Clear, concise and persuasive written and oral presentation skills
Must be able to travel occasionally outside of the Westford, MA area, primarily domestic
Additional Information: The people behind our products are responsible for our company's success, and we take your career ambitions seriously. As a NETSCOUT Systems employee, you'll enjoy a generous benefits package, including a liberal vacation policy, matching 401k plan, tuition reimbursement, medical, dental, domestic partner benefits, company-paid life insurance, short & long term disability & AD&D. We also offer both a Flexible Medical & Childcare Spending Account.

NETSCOUT Systems, Inc. is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer.

Requirements:

Education
Bachelors (or equivalent work experience)
Bachelors (or equivalent work experience)
Job Type
Full-Time
Full-Time

MA - Westford
MA - Westford
Preferred Language
English

Kaman Automation, a business unit of Kaman Distribution, is a nationally recognized leader in the high-tech motion control and automation industry. As a distributor, we have access to a wide variety of products and technologies. Our distributor division supports the industry's top manufacturers. For most of these product lines, we are their largest distributor. With more than 50 years of experience in the motion control field, our staff consists of highly qualified people with extensive knowledge of the motion control industry. We stay up to date with current technology to provide you with quality, state-of-the-art products with the technical support to back them.
We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Director, Human Resources to join our team in Boston, MA (branch located in Franklin, MA)
Reporting to the Vice President of Kaman Automation, the Human Resources Director plans, organizes, directs and controls the activities of the Human Resources functions in order to ensure effective programs and compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This position is responsible for implementing strategic plans, supporting margin and profitability goals. They will work closely with the business leaders and will have a dotted-line reporting relationship to the Vice President of Human Resources, Kaman Distribution Group.

Participates on Business Segment Team to assist in the implementation of the strategic plan. Implements goals and objectives in Human Resources and provides leadership to an organization of 420 employees, 20 locations across the US and $225 Million in sales.
Provides leadership to Human Resources to ensure a high level of productivity, quality and customer service. Ensures teamwork, communicates information and provides feedback to direct reports. Determines performance expectations, evaluates performance and provides coaching and development opportunities.
Formulates Human Resources business plans, goals, objectives and policies. Establishes and enforces organization standards.
Oversees the development and administration of: Organizational development, employee relations, recruitment and retention, training and professional development, performance management, diversity, affirmative action plan, compliance and reporting and benefits administration.
Provides leadership and consulting support to business leaders on goal setting, policy development and strategic implementation in support of achieving objectives and business growth.
Implements and improves Lean processes to ensure increased efficiencies and effectiveness.
Provides a high level of service to all internal and external customers. Ensures that a positive teamwork environment is maintained in Human Resources.
Accountable for organizing, developing, and promoting programs to ensure that operations and activities meet and exceed regulatory requirements, maintain programs to promote and maintain a safe and healthy workplace.
Play an active role in promoting the company’s culture and values and be perceived as a trusted resource to the business leaders.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Management; MBA or professional certification preferred.
Experience:
Minimum of 10 years in a leadership position in Human Resources
Excellent generalist experience, with a proven track record of managing Human Resources programs in a business of comparable size and complexity
Strong proficiency in developing and implementing Human Resources programs, policies and procedures, with a working knowledge of appropriate laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to the business
Demonstrated experience in developing and executing effective programs for performance management, employee development, success planning & talent management, and recruiting, working with a diverse employee base
Capable understanding of the role of Human Resources leadership in a non-union environment
Prior experience in distribution a plus
Working knowledge of Lean process and involvement in continuous programs
Skills and Abilities:
The ability to operate within an environment where change happens frequently and adapting to changes in circumstances is important for success.
Strategic thinker, able to drive decision-making
Self-aware leader, highly sensitive to key elements affecting culture, employee morale, functional performance and the business’s ability to attain its overall objectives
Experience working in a matrix environment and a demonstrated ability to inform and provide leadership to ancillary functional areas.
Superior interpersonal skills; ability to work effectively with all levels, backgrounds, and functions.
Strong verbal and written communication skills; must be able to make effective presentations, to negotiate, to listen and to influence.
Organized, focused on the priorities of the business, excellent problem solving skills, results oriented.
Well-developed managerial style, with a strong emphasis on team-building and teamwork.
Kaman Distribution Group is comprised of three business units: Kaman Automation, Kaman Fluid Power, and Kaman Industrial Technologies. We offer more than four million items including bearings, mechanical power transmission, electrical and automation, material handling, motion control, fluid power and MRO supplies to customers in virtually every industry. Additionally, we provide engineering, design and support for automation, electrical, linear, hydraulic and pneumatic systems as well as belting and rubber fabrication, customized mechanical services, hose assemblies, repair, fluid analysis and motor management. Offering products and solutions from more than 250 locations, our people are the foundation of our success. We recognize that our ability to sustain our competitive advantage rests among our talent.

Job Title: Director, HR Business Partner – G&A & Commercial

Job Description:
Unleash Your Potential
It takes curiosity and intellectual courage to accomplish great things. It takes brave minds to bring powerful ideas to reality and transform healthcare.
We are a diverse, global team that shares a passion for collaboration and solving complex problems. Together, we help customers drive healthcare forward.
Join IQVIA and see where your skills can take you.
BASIC FUNCTIONS:
Works with Clinical Operations Management staff to ensure the successful management, performance, and career development of Clinical Trial Managers (CTMs), Lead Clinical Research Associates (CRAs) Clinical Research Associates (CRAs) and Clinical Operations Analysts (CMOAs). Provides training and consultation related to clinical operating activities in the conduct of clinical trial projects. Serves as a source of clinical research expertise for IQVIA Biotech (PL) clinical staff. Contributes to, and participates in, the marketing of IQVIA Biotech services. Assures compliance with Good Clinical Practices (GCPs), ICH, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Working Practices (WPs), and policies and procedures set forth by IQVIA Biotech and its clients.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for the following activities:
Clinical Staff Line Management Duties/Responsibilities:
Line management for assigned CTMs, Lead CRAs and CRAs (both office and regionally based) in the following areas:
Staff career development
Anticipates resource issues and plan remedial action.
Communicates with the CTMs and/or Lead CRA, as needed, to ensure correct monitoring resources per project.
Liaise with Project Managers to ensure monitoring deliverables/targets are met, ensure project hours are met, ensure excessive total hours are noted and action taken as necessary.
Ensures any project issues and results of discussions with Project Managers and are escalated appropriately.
In coordination with the Director, Clinical Operations ensures proper allocation of Operations resources.
Assesses training requirements for monitoring staff.
Organizes appropriate training in liaison with the IQVIA Biotech e-process and Integration (Training) Department. Monitors and records subsequent performance to assess the effects of training on efficiency.
Conducts field evaluation visits with staff at sites.
Holds regular one-on-one meetings with staff to discuss performance.
Writes and delivers performance appraisals.
Reviews and approve time sheets and expense reports as required.

Coach, train, and support direct reports:
Provides staff with expert clinical research and therapeutic advice.
Assists with organizing and conducting Lead CRA, CTM and CRA Staff Meetings at regular intervals.
Addresses issues discovered at meetings.
Maintains an awareness of company policies so as to effectively represent the company perspective to clinical staff.
Identifies training needs and ensure staff participation during in-house training activities as required.
Collaborates with Director, Clinical Operations to develop and administer an effective orientation/on-boarding process for new CTM, Lead CRA and CRA hires.
Maintains awareness of overall development in the field of clinical research and ensures that staff remains current on clinical monitoring developments.
Clinical Operations Department Duties/Responsibilities:

Assists Clinical Operations Management with review and revision of departmental SOPs, working practices, and policies.
Assists Clinical Operations Management with interviewing and making hiring recommendations and/or decisions on new staff.
Communicates staff increase and equipment needs to Director, Clinical Operations.
Communicates staff training needs to Director, Clinical Operations.
Assists Director, Clinical Operations to create and deliver new department initiatives, improvement plans or training
Assists Director, Clinical Operations with development of strategic departmental goals which correlate with corporate goals, and formalize departmental action plans to meet those goals.
Assists in developing department budget and is accountable for the profit/loss and the overall financial performance of the Clinical department.
Assists Director, Clinical Operations with Process Improvement Plans and other special projects as required by the department.
Provides clinical management oversight of clinical projects to ensure consistent on-time completion of client deliverables and timely escalation and resolution of issues.
Collaborates with other department and/or functional groups to ensure consistency of processes.
Project Duties/Responsibilities:

May serve as CTM for projects as directed.
Assists CTMs with defining the scope of work with the clinical monitoring team.
Assists CTMs with identifying changes in scope.
Provides vacation coverage for CTMs as required.
Provides clinical expertise to project team as needed.
Business Development Duties/Responsibilities:

Participate in the development of the clinical portion of client proposals including preparation of clinical project budget and text.
Preparation for and attendance at capabilities and bid defense meetings.
Participate in marketing activities, client presentations, and proposal development.
Participate in and/or attend professional and industry meetings as a representative of IQVIA Biotech.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Thorough knowledge of clinical research process, including working knowledge of all functional areas of clinical trial management.
Strong communication skills (verbal and written) to express complex ideas.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Positive attitude and ability to interact with all levels of staff.
Ability to balance needs of the organization with needs of staff.
Ability to protect confidential/sensitive information.
Ability to manage multiple priorities within the department and across staff.
Ability to reason independently for the purpose of assessing and recommending specific solutions in clinical settings.
Ability to mentor and train clinical staff.
Understanding of basic data processing functions, including electronic data capture.
Working knowledge of Word, Excel, and Power Point.
Working knowledge of current ICH/GCP guidelines and applicable country specific regulations.
Able to qualify for a major credit card.
Valid driver’s license; ability to rent automobile.
Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally as required.
MINIMUM RECRUITMENT STANDARDS:
BS/BA (or equivalent) in a life sciences program or RN/BSN (or equivalent) with a minimum of 8 years direct experience in clinical studies or equivalent level of education, training and experience. Understanding of the entire clinical research process mandatory.
Four+ years previous experience in personnel management within a clinical research environment.
At least 5 years as a Clinical Research Associate/Clinical Monitor, prefer at least 4 years as a successful Lead CRA/Clinical Trial Manager.
Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate a group of clinical research personnel.
Excellent organizational, communication (verbal and written), and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently, prioritize and function effectively within a matrix team environment.
Working knowledge of Word, Excel, and Power Point.
Prior global/multi region trial management experience is required.
Prior proposal development and bid defense participation is required.
Prior budget development and management experience is required.
Prior experience in electronic data capture (EDC) is preferred.
Prior site management experience is required.
Prior project team leadership/management is required.
Prior vendor management experience is preferred.
Prior experience in a Clinical Research Organization (CRO) is required.
CRITICAL JOB FUNCTIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ADA CRITERIA:
Ability to travel domestically and internationally up to 40%.
Very limited physical effort required to perform normal job duties.
CLASSIFICATION (US):
This position is classified as exempt under the Fair Labor Standards Act; employees are not eligible for overtime compensation.

Job Description:
At UMass Memorial Health Care, Everyone is a Caregiver regardless of title. Exceptional patient care, academic excellence and leading-edge research make UMass Memorial the premier health care system of Central and Western Massachusetts, and a place where we can help you build the career you deserve. We are more than 14,000 employees, working together as one health care system. And everyone, in their own unique way, plays an important part, everyday.

Requisition #: 204105
Title: Human Resources Business Partner
Department: Human Resources
Status: Exempt
Shift: Days
Hours: 40
Location: UMass Memorial Medical Center
This position may require travel and support of multiple sites - University Campus, Memorial Campus, HealthAlliance-Clinton Leominster Campus, UMass Memorial - Marlborough Hospital etc.

Position Summary:

Serve as a strategic partner for all HR matters in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Develops and fosters trusting relationships with all levels of management and employees within the organization to gain support for Medical Center initiatives and achieve results. Advises clients on performance management and provides guidance to line management. Regularly reviews and makes recommendations to management for improvement of the organization’s policies, procedures and practices. Responsible for the planning, coordination, development, implementation and administration of policies and programs covering all human resources functions with an emphasis on employee relations and labor relations. Acts as a business partner and consults with managers and others to assess clients’ needs and to review the quality of the Human Resource Department’s services.

Position Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration with concentration in Human Resources or an equivalent field and five years of relevant experience. Requires knowledge of human resources theory, principles and practices. Working knowledge of such disciplines as the recruitment function, training, compensation, employee relations, labor relations, and benefits administration. Must have good communications, program management, project management, facilitation, decision–making, critical thinking and listening skills. Must have prior Employee Relations coaching/mentoring expertise, as well as a functional understanding of the organization. Must have proven problem solving, mediation and analysis experience. Must be self–directed and motivated. Must have the ability to multi–task and manage time in a complex environment.

Major Responsibilities:
Advise and coach managers and employees in assigned client groups in the application and interpretation of Human Resources policies, labor union contracts, and employee relations. Mediate problems between managers and employees. Participate in the grievance process, labor management meetings, arbitrations, MCAD claims, and all other legal proceedings. Advise clients on performance management, EEO/diversity, transfers, and terminations.
Conduct in–depth investigations regarding employee relations matters; including but not limited to: EEO, sexual harassment, hostility and violence in the workplace, domestic violence, impairment and drug diversion. Make recommendations regarding terminations and disciplinary action.
Assess critical situations and make sound decisions to involve additional resources including Police and Security, EAP, and emergency mental health, to ensure a safe work environment.
Assist managers in the development and implementation of employee relations efforts designed to build trust and enhance employee engagement. Recommend and ensure appropriate documentation, training and corrective action plans when necessary.
Act as advocate and advisor to employees and leaders regarding career and leadership development initiatives.
Standards of Respect:

We’re striving to make respect a part of everything we do at UMass Memorial – for our patients and for each other. We’re expecting that our new caregivers practice our six Standards of Respect: Acknowledge, Listen, Communicate, Be Responsive, Be a Team Player, and Be Kind, to help us make respect a part of how we take care of business everyday.

Job Description:
Join us as Senior Program Manager, Supply Chain and make an impact supporting our world-class leadership brands including: OXO, Hydro Flask, Vicks, Braun, Honeywell, PUR, Hot Tools, and Drybar. Join this exceptional team to bring people outstanding products that elevate lives everywhere, every day. This position can be based in Southaven, MS, Olive Branch, MS, El Paso, TX, Bend, OR, New York, NY, Marlborough, MA, or Irvine, CA.

This position is temporarily eligible for Work from Home until our offices reopen in El Paso, TX, Bend, OR, New York, NY, Marlborough, MA, or Irvine, CA. Once our offices reopen, this position is not eligible to be Work from Home, and you will be required to report to the office Monday-Friday.

What contribution will I make to Helen of Troy?

The primary role of the Senior Program Manager, Supply Chain is to support the Program Management Office (PMO) for thought-leadership and project management expertise to deliver key strategic initiatives and critical Program(s)/Project(s) within the constraints of scope, quality, time and budget for Helen of Troy. This office is building and leading all facets of a company wide effort in executing enterprise initiatives by creating a “Center of Excellence” model, incorporating PM standardized processes, methodologies, tools, and strategies. The Program Manager proactively collaborates with Helen of Troy internal project teams working on corporate initiatives/opportunities and others involved in the delivery of the program (including subject matter experts, Helen of Troy functions and external consultants).

General areas of responsibility include: liaison with project teams and other groups within Helen of Troy supporting the program, involvement in the development and assessment of business cases, project planning, risk mitigation, contingency planning, production and oversight of key progress reports, oversight of tracking and assimilation of program realization and KPI data, bridging variances to financial plan, and preparation of materials for internal meetings.

What you’ll be doing

Financial Management:
Engage in the development and ensure high quality of business cases from business teams, ensuring assumptions validity, and approach to tracking
Establish and maintain expectations for tracking status reports, financial data and operational metrics
Oversee program realization data (value capture tracking) across project teams monthly throughout the duration of each program. Review of variances to plan and work with teams on path to close gaps.
Support the review of KPIs and other metrics with Business Partners and initiative/opportunity teams
Support the PMO team to develop and enhance templates, processes, and systems for the program as appropriate
Proactively provides performance optimization recommendations to the BU/Functional stakeholders and follows through to deliver timely resolution; solves for the underlying cause of a problem
Program Implementation & Control:
Ensure compliance of staff and project participants to Helen of Troy's project management tools, techniques, project lifecycle methodologies and audit requirements. Support and contribute to the improvement of project management methods and practices. Champions a standard project management methodology and technology systems development lifecycle through training and education.
Support production of materials for weekly/bi-weekly PMO meetings
Provide project management support to ensure Helen of Troy initiatives are completed within budget and on schedule
Gather feedback from owners/team members on deviations to plan and actions taken to resolve issues
Proactively communicate with PMO team members ensuing project objectives are being achieved
Capture insights from lessons learned to ensure best practices are curated and implemented
Take ownership and action to deliver timely, quality results and when dealing with ambiguity or risk to exceed stakeholder and customer expectations
Communication:
Conduct or participate in PMO team meetings to ensure Helen of Troy objectives are met
Conduct or participate in regular meetings with internal stakeholders to ensure they are fully informed of Helen of Troy’s progress and how the program objectives are being achieved
Support and ensure high quality of the production of monthly and quarterly program update reports for management including Executive Leadership team and Board of Directors
Summarize complex information to management, and flag risks and opportunities timely and as appropriate
What are the requirements for consideration?
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. MBA degree preferred.
PMP/Lean/Six Sigma/Agile certification a plus
7+ years of relevant experience
Advanced knowledge/experience with Supply Chain and Distribution Center operations
Strong interpersonal and team building skills. Ability to work project and cross-functional issues with other management leaders demonstrating negotiation and resource management skills. Ability to interface with all levels of staff, including top management.
Ability to summarize complex situations into key points. Good presentation skills. Strong verbal & written communication skills.
Excellent problem-solving skills. Strong organizational and multitasking skills, and ability to take structured approach to varied work assignments.
Adaptability to work successfully with geographically and culturally diverse teams
Highly motivated, self-starting individual who can see the big picture but lead and coordinate people to achieve the broader vision
Experience with conflict resolution
Experience with Risk Mitigation Planning
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office packages such as Excel, MS Project, PowerPoint, Hyperion. Working knowledge of Oracle is beneficial.
Proven relevant experience in consultancy, or project management
Experience managing large, complex projects
Experience with Portfolio and Project management software tools
Proven global experience is a plus
Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis
For more information about Helen of Troy, visit www.helenoftroy.com. You can also find us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

Incorporated in 1968, Helen of Troy has grown into a leading global consumer products company with career opportunities in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. We offer creative solutions for our customers through a diversified portfolio of well-recognized and widely trusted brands, including OXO®, Hydro Flask®, Vicks®, Braun®, Honeywell®, PUR®, Hot Tools®, Drybar®. Most of these brands rank #1 or #2 in their respective categories.

We boldly bring brands into our family, where we nurture what makes them great. We collaborate internally and externally, always striving to provide the consumer-centric innovation, operational excellence, scale, global reach, and stellar shared services to make them soar.

VSE Corporation is currently seeking a Sr. Human Resources Generalist for its headquarters in Alexandria, VA. This position partners with the business to ensure people-related matters are aligned with the VSE culture and business objectives while being compliant, effective, and efficient. The Human Resources Generalist will have accountability for policy and compliance, employee and labor relations, compensation, benefits, HRIS, performance management, and learning and development.

The Senior Human Resources Generalist partners with the business to ensure people-related matters are aligned with business goals and objectives while being compliant, effective, and efficient. The incumbent has accountability for both day-to-day and project-based activities supporting policy and compliance, employee and labor relations, compensation, benefits, HRIS, performance management, and learning and development for the Federal Services Group.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Advising on human resource policies and programs to ensure alignment with business goals and objectives and prevent or mitigate violations of legal guidelines and internal policies and procedures; developing, updating, and communicating human resources policies to employees; participating in various internal and external audits; identifying and implementing of human resources best practices suitable for the business group; maintaining compliance records, conducting research, and preparing reports.*
Implementing and coordinating employee and labor relations policies, procedures, and programs related to new hire onboarding, equal employment opportunity, employee counseling and performance improvement plans, separations, as well as investigations of discrimination, harassment, and other employment violations; advising employees on human resources policies as well as conflict resolution, disciplinary actions, and grievances; investigating and resolving discrimination complaints and problems; auditing internal employee and labor practices to identify corrective action; identifying major trends and underlying employee and labor relations issues.*
Supporting ongoing efforts to improve the performance and satisfaction of employees through a variety of educational methods and programs; conducting skills inventory and recommending solutions for addressing gaps; developing, coordinating, and delivering various training programs to include onboarding, performance management, management skills, and annual compliance training; recommends externally available training programs and vendors when necessary; evaluating and reporting on the efficacy of established learning and development programs to maximize return on investment; supporting change management initiatives.*
Reviewing internal studies and market analyses on a variety of compensation-related subjects including job evaluation and pricing, base pay and incentive pay practices, and performance review systems; recommends pay procedures and salary adjustments; supporting annual goal setting and performance review activities; assisting managers with interpreting wage and salary policies and procedures; developing and updating job descriptions; ensuring proper FLSA designations; preparing wage and salary plans and reports as requested.*
Advising employees on eligibility for benefit programs, to include union and SCA specific plans; in collaboration with the benefits and payroll staff, investigating, analyzing, and resolving issues or problems related to benefit plan enrollment, payroll contributions, etc.; facilitating benefits overview discussions for new hires and annual open enrollment meetings as needed.*
Creating and maintaining employee documentation, correspondence, and records; establishing and communicating procedures required to standardize and record employment actions, mass events, etc. in an accurate, efficient, and timely manner; running routine and ad hoc queries and reports; developing various metrics and analytics.*
Other duties as assigned.
* Essential function

Job Requirements

JOB REQUIREMENTS *

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related discipline with a minimum of eight (8) years’ human resources experience in a federal government contracting environmen.
Proficiency using various software, applications, and programs including Microsoft Office Suite, HRIS, benefit enrollment systems, and timekeeping/payroll platforms; experience with Costpoint 7, Deltek T&E, and ADP Workforce Now required.
In-depth knowledge of federal, state, local and federal contractor employment laws and compliance programs; experience researching and implementing human resources best practices.
Expert presentation skills; experience facilitating formal meetings and focus groups with a variety of audiences.
Superb attention-to-detail as well as organizational and time management skills.
Adept at conducting research and problem-solving; ability to analyze and evaluate problems and apply human resources best practices.
Expert conflict resolution skills to reach satisfactory resolutions of employee and labor relations issues.
Demonstrated communication and customer service skills with the ability to build effective working relationships with employees at various levels within the organization.
Experience with the integration of SCA regulations, Executive Order 13495, and Union regulations for government contractors.
Ability to manage a high volume of assignments with varying complexity and competing priorities in a fast-paced environment with integrity and professionalism.
Ability quickly and easily adapt to changing organizational and departmental needs.
Must be resourceful, use sound judgement, and understand when to elevate issues due to risk or complexity.
High sensitivity for protocol and confidentiality.
Preferred Requirements:
Union and/or SCA experience a plus
HRCI or SHRM certification highly desired.
MENTAL REQUIREMENTS: Think Analytically, Effective Verbal Communication, Effective Written Communication, Make Decisions, Observe/Examine Details, Remember Details, Interpret Data, Concentrate on Tasks, Adjust to Changes, Handle Stress/Emotions.

PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS: Regular Attendance, Maintain Work Schedule, Irregular Hours, Attend Meetings, Meet Deadlines, Keyboard/Type, Handle Confidential Info, Use Math/Calculations, Stay Organized.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Sit, Talk, Hear, See, Repetitive Motion, Eye/Hand Coordination, Lifting Up to 10 Pounds, Carrying Up to 10 Pounds.

ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: Noise.

Company Description

Symbotic’s talented and diverse workforce develops disruptive robotic solutions for warehouse automation and supply chain transformation, drives results and focuses on customer satisfaction. Our modular and scalable solutions utilize existing space and high-speed robotics combined with proprietary software and technology. Since forming in 2007, Symbotic has grown to over 700 employees in North America and supports an impressive, high-profile customer base. We seek candidates who are passionate about our solution and approach problem solving with a creative mind and a commitment to excellence. If you seek a challenge and want to impact the way the world distributes product from manufacturers to store shelves, we invite you to join our team.

Job Description

Symbotic is looking for a Compensation and Benefits Manager who will be responsible for managing the organization’s health and welfare programs and policies. In this role, the Manager will utilize their subject matter expertise to develop compensation and benefits strategies in alignment with the company’s goals and objectives. They will also provide insights to assess the effectiveness and quality of compensation plans and programs. They will collaborate with the CHRO to deliver programs/services to leadership and team members that reflect the strategic business objective of the organization. This position will maintain company compensation and benefits programs and build strong relationships with vendors and employees as a valued and trusted source of information. In addition, this position will be responsible for maintaining and improving HR systems and business processes with a focus on data quality.

Job Responsibilities:

Leads and executes health and welfare benefit programs.
Works with insurance broker and plan carriers related to plan design, plan administration and compliance to applicable employment laws.
Audits benefits plans for compliance with government regulations; prepares and submits all government-mandated reports.
Leads annual benefits renewal process and recommends go-forward approaches taking into consideration feedback from leadership, market research and cost analysis.
Facilitates annual renewal and enrollment process including preparation of employee communications and updating benefit enrollment information.
Develops new communication materials, strategies and project plans to enhance employees’ understanding of benefits offerings.
Provides hands-on benefits administration support in coordination with Senior HR Coordinator (including enrollment, terminations, invoice reconciliation, etc.)
Responsible for ensuring all employee notices are posted or distributed as required” (this includes ensuring posters are updated as need at site, benefits plans notices, new hire notices, termination notices, etc).
Facilitates all employee leaves (FMLA, PLOA, LOA, Workers Comp, etc.)
Handles Unemployment process & managing related claims
Coordinates 401k administration and related process.
Researches and proposes competitive base and incentive pay programs to ensure the organization attracts and retains top talent.
Performs analysis utilized to guide leadership on policy and guideline interpretation, pay decisions and job evaluations.
Establishes salary ranges and evaluates job positions to determine classification and appropriate salary recommendations.
Develops compensation programs that are in alignment with our company strategies and monitors those programs against industry trends.
Drives annual review, preparation and administration of the organization’s compensation program
Selects and participates in relevant compensation surveys
Ensures our compensation practices continue to be in compliance with all government regulations
This position has supervisory responsibility.
Subject matter expert for the continued system optimization of the Workday Human Capital management System
Serve as liaison among Human Resources, Benefits, Recruitment, and Payroll areas with regard to operations and the HRIS
This individual will also drive analysis and metrics, support functional areas with HR system operations, and provide focus on business processes and application support activities, configurations, security, and optimization.
Create and manage business requirement documents, system configuration documents, change management documentation for current usage and future updates within the HRIS system
Troubleshoot, analyze, detect, identify and correct technical problems and deficiencies
Constantly seeks to leverage HR technology to advance processes that maximize efficiency and accuracy and minimize exposure

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Finance or equivalent work experience and/or education
5+ years managing Compensation and Benefits
2+ years managing HRIS systems
At least three years of strong HR operational/management experience.
CCP (Certified Compensation Professional) and/or CEBS (Certified Employee Benefits Specialist) certification a strong plus.
Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR) certification preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge of human resource policy and law (e.g, SHRM guidelines, DOL and EEOC regulations, and employee grievance/relations)

Additional Information

Symbotic offers competitive compensation and a dynamic, growing company environment. Benefits include very comprehensive coverage for medical, dental, life, disability, flexible spending accounts, and more.

Symbotic is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on age, gender, physical or mental disability, nation of origin, veteran status, religious beliefs, sexual identity or expression. Symbotic supports a diverse workforce and we are committed to a work environment free of discrimination and harassment, where all are treated with dignity and respect.

Luxury Marketing Manager

The Luxury Marketing Manager is directly responsible to develop, foster and strengthen relationships with select top producing &/or luxury real estate agents affiliated with Coldwell Banker Realty to become a single point of contact/resource for their marketing needs. The position supports all key marketing objectives and goals and works to ensure that the company and agent’s brand image is well represented within the framework of the brand, brokerage, Coldwell Banker Global Luxury, and Core 4. The Luxury Marketing Manager may support multiple Premier Offices in the local operating company with a concentration on luxury property marketing and focused on select Agents.

The Luxury Marketing Manager may assist with the production of program components such as listing presentations and marketing plans while focusing on the larger aspects of the program such as consumer targeting, distribution strategies, and budgeting.

This role will be responsible for supporting the Boston area. This position is fully remote for the foreseeable future. As we come out of the pandemic and are sure that it’s safe to resume operations, this role will be required to travel to offices in and around Boston.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Proactive Support to Independent Sales Associates

Work proactively with top independent sales associates and their assistants/teams to support their marketing needs and business goals, with all efforts focused on the delivery of the company's Agent Value Proposition.

Provide high level support via one-on-one meetings, group training, phone, and email support to agents, their teams, their support staff and their marketing assistants with marketing strategies.

Effectively communicate the entire Coldwell Banker Global Luxury marketing program deliver the benefits of the luxury marketing program at high-end listing appointments

Events, Awareness, and Communications

Implement and support company and agent awareness program including event management, coordination with public relations and communications resources, and award & recognition team.

Leverage regional resources to deliver luxury market position messaging internally and externally.

Strategic Market Planning & Delivery

Drive the local luxury marketing planning process and lead the execution of local luxury programs.

Execute a local marketing plan on behalf of the company or on behalf of an agent, including advertising, public relations, strategies, and tactical implementation.

Plan, implement, and manage an assigned office’s luxury marketing budget allocation with direct P&L responsibility.

Deliver company value propositions, concierge programs, company tools & services that fit accordingly with agent value propositions.

Leverage National Marketing Studio Capabilities and Services

Assess luxury marketing related needs of the local company and then engage the national marketing Studio to produce creative materials, advertising, and campaigns.

Interact with Field Marketing Director and other regional marketing personnel in coordination with the budgeting and fulfillment of advertising, event management, awards & recognition, top affiliated agent recruiting support, public relations opportunities, finance, and creative services.

Support to Local Operating Company Senior Leadership

Serve as a proactive, integral marketing team liaison of the Field Marketing Director and local management team providing marketing support and counsel to the President.

Prepare and participate in VIP recruiting opportunities, business development opportunities, and agent retention efforts.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field preferred

Minimum of 5 years of multi-channel marketing experience in a medium/large professional services company with emphasis on luxury clientele

Prior real estate industry experience preferred

Experience working effectively in a multi-functional, multi-location team preferred

Expert knowledge with social media, online, and traditional advertising

Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to handle small copywriting jobs as well as presentation writing and presentation development

Excellent customer service skills combined with demonstrated relationship building abilities

Must have polished public speaking adeptness and ability to deliver compelling and professional presentations

Ability to generate a complete creative brief

Detail-oriented with the ability to manage projects from inception through execution, including demonstrated success in conceptualizing new programs and tracking the progress of projects to completion

Demonstrated ability to work well in a minimally supervised, fast-paced environment combined with strong collaboration skills

Strong working knowledge with MS Office– Excel, PowerPoint, Project Management systems, and CRM systems

Ability to travel to local branch offices, regional meetings and occasional out of town travel as required

Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

BCG Platinion


As a seamlessly integrated part of the BCG network, we provide consulting services focused on the development and implementation of business-critical IT architecture and digital solutions. We create technology platforms and deliver exceptionally customized solutions of the future for our clients, from data strategies to next-generation customer journey solutions and transformational business models. We solve the most daunting challenges that companies face today and envision for tomorrow. Our style is entrepreneurial – nimble and innovative, with multifaceted, cross-functional teams and completely vendor-independent. Our unique selling proposition is technology expertise and delivery excellence.

Platinion was founded in 2000. Since then, we have grown continuously and successfully. Today we have offices in Europe, North and South America, Asia Pacific and Africa.

Practice Area Profile

BCG Platinion launched in Germany in 2000 to add deep technical expertise to the Boston Consulting Group’s existing capabilities. Today, our presence spans across the globe, with offices in Asia, Europe, and South and North America. Our New York-based North American team began in 2014 and in 2017 acquired MAYA Design, a Pittsburgh-based digital design and innovation lab, to grow our capabilities around technology and design. We support our clients’ total digital transformation through technology, design, cybersecurity, and risk management & financial engineering capabilities. And together with BCG, BCG Platinion’s interdisciplinary team of technical experts enable customized technical solutions and accelerate delivery value through new business platforms, application consolidations, and major system implementations.

What You'll Do

At BCG Platinion, we’re bringing design to the front line of business challenges, creating work that solves problems in novel, feasible, and desirable ways. Our team applies a discovery-driven approach in order to create innovative and exciting end-to-end experiences at the intersection of people and technology. As a chief enterprise architect, you will collaborate on interdisciplinary teams of designers, engineers, researchers, technical experts, and consultants to develop leading IT concepts and architectural solutions. In this role, you will apply your sound technical know-how, understanding of business contexts, and analytical skills to enable organizations to technically transform.

Chief Enterprise Architects at BCG Platinion are:

· Technical experts. They are critical thinkers and have extensive IT expertise that drives novel solutions routed in complexity.

· Comfortable with ambiguity. They know the path forward isn’t always well-defined. They are comfortable and confident working through the unknown.

· Change agents. They know how to make change happen across an organization. They can align and onboard teams to implement new processes and toolsets. They embrace complex challenges and guide an organization to optimize IT best practices.

· Agile advocates. They are well-versed in agile methodologies and use their expertise to strategically tackle difficult challenges and implement change.

· Collaborative. They are interdisciplinary team players who seek alignment and establish relationships ranging from cross-functional stakeholder groups to existing teams.

· Innovative. They are creative thinkers who apply their deep IT architecture expertise to envision novel design patterns for the next generation of technology solutions.

· Knowledgeable. They have a sophisticated understanding of IT Architecture, acting as a viable resource on teams as both a hands-on practitioner and subject matter expert.

You’re good at:

· Solution, application, enterprise architecture and business capability mapping

· Restructuring IT processes and organization

· Supporting IT functions during mergers and acquisitions, including the functional and technical transformation of an organization’s IT department

· Evaluating an organization’s IT and software architecture

· Assessing and implementing IT architectures

· Evaluating products, such as core systems

· Developing technical concepts development and designing of software solutions

· Assessing quality assurance for IT implementation

· Designing work packages/modules in IT implementation projects

· Reviewing technical architecture and code

· Executing technical proofs of concept

· Analyzing complex IT application landscapes and status quo for IT architecture optimization

· Developing functional and technical online and Internet strategies

· Optimizing the application development processes

· Developing team’s talent by providing direction and facilitating technical architectural discussions

· Contribute to BCG Platinion’s consulting business by:

o Assisting with business development through writing proposals, scoping projects

Contributing to our thought leadership through written publications and speaking at events and conferences

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)

You bring:
Masters in information technology, business administration, computer science, business management, or system controls & engineering or a related field
10 to 15+ years of professional experience in software engineering with more than 4 years in architecture discipline
Superior technical knowledge, engineering rigor, and creative problem-solving
Ability to explain complex technology topics to senior executives
Extensive technical expertise and knowledge of:
Various technology stacks
Mainframe architecture (nice to have, but not must)
Cloud native applications and cloud services architecture
Omnichannel architecture
Integration methodologies and tools
API and Microservices architecture
Structured and unstructured databases and usage patterns
High-speed, high-volume, high-frequency transaction processing systems
Real-time logging, monitoring and resiliency approaches
Disaster recovery and business continuity planning
Next gen capabilities (e.g. AI/ML, IoT, Blockchain) and component technologies
Data analytics architecture (e.g. Data Lake)
Programming paradigms and approaches (e.g. object-oriented)
Process automation approaches and tooling (e.g. DevOps, AIOps)
Experience in agile engineering and tooling support
An agile mindset that moves past blockers and a vision to iteratively migrate to the next/modern set of architecture capabilities with a lens of business benefits/value
Willingness to travel to work with clients and BCG teams. At times, this role involves significant travel to client sites. The amount of travel will depend on client needs and nature of projects

Company Information

BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey and unlocking potential to advance.

03-Jan-2020

Location: Corporate
Posted Date: 6/16/2020
Summary:
The Director of Human Resources serves as the primary interface between Human Resources and hospital leadership. The Director of Human Resources consults and collaborates with the hospital CEO/President, Senior Leadership Team and frontline management across the full spectrum of HR issues. The Director builds, develops and leads the entity HR team in support of both the HR and entity missions and objectives. The Director ensures an entity HR team capable of meeting the highest standards of customer service and leverages personal knowledge of HR content and best practices to assure thorough alignment of HR and organizational strategy.

Key Responsibilities
• Credible activist and key business ally to all entity leadership and leadership teams regarding Norwood's strategic, cultural, operational talent investments.
• Advises Entity leaders on HR issues including employee and labor relations, training, performance management, leadership development, compensation & benefits administration, talent acquisition.
• Facilitates activities and makes decisions concerning employment and employee relations.
• Conducts employee training on HR policies and programs.
• Ensures HR programs support the direction and goals of the Entity while maintaining System alignment.
• Acts as an advocate for local employees in the design of system-wide HR programs.
• Partners with Corporate HR to implement system-wide initiative and programs.
• Responsible for labor relations which may include union negotiations; local liaison, Employee & Labor Relations.
• Ensures adherence to Employee Relations philosophy and HR policies and practices to achieve alignment across the system.
• Has input to and manages the operating and capital budgets for Entity HR.
• Ensures compliance with union contracts and/or regulatory requirements.
• Directs and manages performance and development of assigned personnel.
• Promotes, models and oversees the mission, vision and values of Steward Health Care.

Key Competencies
• Credible activist: Must be both credible and active. Need to be trusted, respected, admired, listened to, have a point of view and take a position.
• Operational executor: Must ensure that employees' basic needs – including being paid, hired, trained, transferred and developed – are efficiently delivered through technology, shared services, and/or outsourcing. Need to adapt and implement HR policies.
• Business partner: Must understand the organization's business, what the revenue sources are, who the customers are and why they choose Steward for their healthcare. Also need basic understanding of the functions of various corporate departments, such as HRIS, finance, marketing, compliance, IT and quality.
• Talent Manager/Organizational Designer: Must have mastery of theory, research, and practice in both talent management and organization design.
• Culture and Change Steward: Recognizes, articulates and helps shape the Entity's culture. Need to be clear about the expectations of patients, and then translate these expectations into internal employee and organizational behaviors. In addition to managing change, must help make culture happen, and develop disciplines to drive changes throughout the organization.
• Strategy Architect: Must recognize business trends and their impact on the business, being able to forecast potential obstacles to success, and facilitate the process of gaining strategic clarity.

Qualifications
• Bachelors degree required; Masters Degree and/or SPHR/PHR preferred
• 7-10 years of broad HR experience required, labor relations & health care experience preferred
• Minimum of 3-5 years of HR management experience, health care preferred
Job Title: HR Director- St. Elizabeth's Medical Center

Job Description:
Join our growing HR team to address organizational needs and lead or participate in a variety of challenging projects. Use and broaden your HR experience while providing guidance and coaching to managers and staff to facilitate and educate on employee relations, performance management and organizational initiatives for a designated department within the product development business area. In addition, work with other HR Business Partners to provide support across all product development groups.

Build a strong business partner relationship with management and staff of a designated department within the product development area. Develop an understanding of their goals and challenges. Help to address systemic issues through facilitation, coaching, counseling and the use of leading edge HR technology. Working closely with other Business Partners in this area, provide broad support across the organization.
Provide consultative guidance to department managers on organizational and staff needs.
Manage and resolve workplace and employee relations matters
Coach and counsel management and staff on the performance management process.
Collaborate with other HR team members, lead projects and participate in HR-related programs and practices.
Support the effective execution of activities such as the performance review and merit planning process.
Ensure consistency, communication and collaboration in a matrixed and global environment.
Use metrics to propose and develop solutions and best practices
Ability to provide guidance and coaching to managers and staff on a variety of issues including employee relations and performance management
A strong understanding of performance management approaches and employment law
Experience facilitating meetings and working on projects with global HR staff across multiple HR disciplines
An aptitude for analytics and problem solving including the ability to diagnose root causes
Ability to work in a time sensitive and confidential environment
Computer skills in MS office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word), SharePoint, Skype for Business, and HRIS (Workday is a plus)
High tech experience preferred
A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience) is required.
Experience with employee relations
