Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

Job Description

Overview

We are seeking a talented and Senior Cybersecurity Program Manager to join our Cybersecurity, Resiliency and Governance Team. You will join a vibrant information security management practice and team that works hard to enable and facilitate business while protecting our people and key information assets located in the US & Canada. You will join a world-class company known for its commitment to diversity, community involvement and work-life balance via the WorkSmart program (employees working from home). Your career will flourish with our strong commitment to personal and professional development and growth (including support for attaining and keeping industry designations and certifications). You will help drive an industry leading Cyber Security program, owning the strategy and execution of multiple business-critical cybersecurity initiatives.

Responsibilities

We are looking to enhance a variety of cyber security controls and Key Risk Indicators (KRI) and as such are seeking a resource to scope, plan, enable, drive, collaborate and support these efforts on a variety of levels. You will be looked to as a program builder who immerses themselves in all aspects of cybersecurity to bridge the gap between business needs and cybersecurity control technical enhancements/implementation(s). You will need to be ready to face a wide range of security questions and challenge the status quo. Our expectation is you will be a subject matter expert in the security domain and push innovative ideas that solve technical and organizational challenges at a global scale. You should have a have strong understanding of DevSecOps and security automation techniques, tools and technologies. You need to be a master communicator and active listener who understands how to navigate an audience. Self-aware, you need to keenly understand how to adjust your approach based on the situation.

Required Skills

The ideal candidate will bring and continuously build upon the following qualifications and skills:

5-7+ years of progressive experience in information security/information risk management
5-7+ years implementing technologies and driving program development
Experience implementing controls to meet some or all of the following frameworks and standards: SOX, SOC 2, ISO 27001/2, NIST, PCI DSS, CIS Top 20, HIPAA, etc.
Experience developing/supporting automated approaches to operate and test controls in a microservice/DevOps environment
Professional certification (or current enrollment in program) for information security – CISSP, CISA, CRISC or similar credentials
Proven ability to build relationships, engage and influence others, and work with diverse internal and international user communities as well as vendors
Achievement oriented with proven leadership skills and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team, managing multiple priorities and deadlines
Strong communicator and active listener with the ability to effectively articulate vision, possibilities, and outcomes

Plus Skills

Previous experience working for a consulting firm
Background as a software engineering, infrastructure / cloud engineering, technical lead, and/or engineering manager
Entrepreneurial aptitude and/or experience

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of June 30, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.9 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

The Human Resources Generalist for the division will be located in our Tewksbury location and will partner with employees across multiple sites across the Analytical Instruments Group (AIG) and the Life Sciences Group (LSG) in Massachusetts.

How will you make an impact?

When you're part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you'll be supported in achieving your career goals.

As the HR partner, you will guide and support talent management, organizational development, performance management, career development, employee relations, compensation planning and change leadership activities.

Collaborates with Center of Excellence (COE) process experts to execute and implement HR initiatives (i.e., roll out of annual programs, new programs, policies) within Laboratory Products across the US.
Provide HR support and coaching to leaders on policies, processes, people management, and career development.
Counsel and/or coach employees and managers regarding employee relations issues including performance management, facilitation of formal/informal investigations, and any resulting disciplinary actions.
Evaluate and advise client groups on the attraction, motivation, development and retention of their teams.
Ensure effective talent attraction and management including recruitment, assessment, and development.
Assist managers in assessing and identifying resources to meet employee training needs.
Participate in the broader Group, Divisional or Regional HR team to drive HR projects and initiatives.
Coach managers on effective use of HR systems (e.g. Workday) to leverage reporting and data insight capabilities.
Perform other duties as assigned.
How will you get here?
Bachelor's degree in HR or related field is required.
Must have 3 or more years of experience in various aspects of human resources (staffing, compensation, employee relations and organizational development). Experience in a matrixed organization is a plus.
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite is required.
Previous experience with HR information systems is required. Workday experience is a plus.
Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality, work independently, multi-task, and follow up on projects and issues
Detail-oriented with strong follow-through
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to interface with all levels of the organization

Available for travel up to 10-15%
Each one of our 75,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission-enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Ardelyx is a publicly traded biotech company focused on improving the lives of patients by developing and commercializing first-in-class targeted therapies that advance patient care. Using our discovery model, Ardelyx scientists have identified completely new biological mechanisms and pathways that have enabled us to develop a pipeline of drug candidates to manage complications related to kidney and cardiovascular diseases. Our lead candidate, tenapanor, is a first-in-class small molecule therapy for the treatment of hyperphosphatemia in adult patients with chronic kidney disease on dialysis. If approved, tenapanor could become a foundational therapy, completely changing the treatment paradigm in a disease state with significant unmet need. Based on our NDA submission in June, we are preparing to commercialize tenapanor with expected FDA approval in mid-2021, and a commercial launch soon thereafter.

Vice President, Human Resources

Purpose of the role:

In this critical role, the Vice President, Human Resources will participate in the development of the company’s plans and programs, acting as a strategic partner who brings the right understanding of the impact of people on an organization. It will be critical that the Vice President, Human Resources establish credibility throughout the organization, be an effective listener and problem solver, working across the full span of people issues, while driving effective talent development, retention, and future hiring. The individual will bring a strategic orientation, critical and creative thinking skills and the organizational sensitivity needed to focus on key objectives. The Vice President, Human Resources will have a strong leadership track record and the gravitas to work across all levels of the organization; managing an organization going through a period of significant growth and increasing complexity.

Major Responsibilities

Leadership:

Effectively partner with the executive leadership team and the organization, working cross-functionally with key leaders and business partners to manage teams, and build the leadership and human capital resources needed to develop the organization. Translate the strategic and tactical business plans into HR strategic and operational plans.

Organizational Design and Function:

Manage complexity and build the organization for growth, including informing organizational structure and ensuring the alignment and development of key internal talent. Create hiring plans for key functions as needed, as well as internal development plans to ensure a strong pipeline of talent.
Bring a track record of leadership needed to continue to transform the organization with effective process and structure. He/she will be attuned to the talent and personnel needs of the current and future organization.

Culture and Inclusion:

Continue to foster a culture of innovation, while providing the right resources, and guidance to support the organization.
Ensure the company continues to prioritize diversity and inclusion; foster an environment that ensures equity and respect for all employees.

Talent Management:

Strategy and Planning: Develop appropriate policies and programs for effective management of the people resources of the company. Evaluate and advise on the talent impact of long-term internal plans, including new programs/strategies, as well as external factors, such as regulatory actions. Inform how these scenarios could impact the attraction, motivation, development and retention of the people resources of the corporation.
Recruiting: Develop staffing strategies and implement plans and programs to identify talent within and outside the corporation for positions of seniority. Identify appropriate and effective external sources for candidates for all levels within the company.
Compensation and Benefits: Develop progressive and proactive compensation and benefits programs to provide motivation, incentives and rewards for effective performance. Provide programs that utilize an employee and company partnership for the short and long-range benefit of all parties.
Leadership and Development: Develop human resource planning models to identify competency, knowledge and talent gaps and execution plans for filling gaps. Areas of activity will include talent management through proper succession planning programs for key contributor and management positions, training and development programs for preparing employees for more significant responsibilities and general development programs to enhance employee knowledge and understanding of the business of the company and industry.

Operations:

Enhance and/or develop, implement and enforce human resources policies and procedures of the organization by way of systems that will improve the overall operation and effectiveness of the corporation.
Continually assess the competitiveness of all programs and practices against the relevant comparable companies, industries and markets. Continue improving the programs, policies, practices and processes associated with meeting the strategic and operational people issues of the organization.
Ensure compliance with employment, benefits, insurance, safety, and other laws, regulations, and requirements.
Maintain knowledge of laws, regulations, and best practices in employment law, human resources, and talent management.
Manage the budget and other financial measures of the Human Resources Department.
Evaluate the human resource division structure and team plan for continual improvement of the efficiency and effectiveness of the group, as well as providing individuals with professional and personal growth.

CANDIDATE SPECIFICATION: KEY SELECTION CRITERIA

Ideal Experience

Minimum of 10 years of relevant HR leadership experience. Experience in a commercial stage biopharmaceutical organization would be valued, but experience from other industries and settings will also be considered.
Proven ability to manage an organization through a complex transition of scale would be ideal.
Broad experience with a range of talent functions, spanning from recruitment to leadership and development to succession planning.
Solid team leadership skills with a proven ability to recruit, retain, develop, and motivate top-notch teams. Values and fosters an innovative, collaborative, purpose-driven corporate culture.
Significant experience and reputation as a strong leader and manager, both within the HR function as well as through influence across all functions and throughout the organization.
A demonstrated track record of serving as a business partner to senior leadership teams with the ability to influence key business decisions and track performance against key objectives.
Bachelor's degree required; advanced degree valued.

Other Personal Characteristics

Highly communicative leader who maintains excellent interpersonal communications, public speaking, and presentation skills.
A desire to work with purpose and passion; demonstrates tenacity and works towards continuous improvement. Possess a desire for, and ability to work in, a hands-on, collaborative environment and with a sense of urgency necessary to support a commercial bio-pharmaceutical entity with newly approved products and an extremely bright future.
A team orientation. Someone who focuses on collective results rather than individual achievements.
The highest ethics and moral standards; unquestioned integrity.
Outstanding intellectual ability with judgment that reflects reasoned and creative business views.
A well organized, high energy, detail oriented, and persistent executive with the ability to identify/focus on key issues, prioritize efforts, and ensure follow up with timely/quality results.

As a member of the Ardelyx team, you will help us in developing and bringing to market first in class medicines to better the lives of underserved patients with cardiorenal diseases. It’s the patients in need that motivate and inspire us to be relentless and work hard every day. They push us to maintain a clear focus on scientific and clinical integrity with a commitment to medical innovation so that we can deliver exceptional medicines.

Ardelyx, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About us: The only predictable thing about life is that it’s wildly unpredictable. That’s where we come in. When life does what it does best, customers turn to goPuff to deliver their everyday essentials, and to get through their day & night, work day and weekend. We’re assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers & risk-takers...the kind of people who know the value of peace of mind in an unpredictable world. (And people who love snacks.) Like what you’re hearing? Welcome to goPuff. The goPuff Fam is committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an equal employment opportunity employer. Overview:

goPuff is seeking a General Manager to join the operations team. We are looking for a self- starting and entrepreneurial strong leader. The General Manager role is an intense and fast-paced role within goPuff that requires drive, grit, positivity, and enthusiasm for the challenge. In this role, you will lead a local team of Shift Leaders and Field Operations Associates overseeing the facility’s operations as well as a team of independent Driver Partners. Ultimately, the success of the territory rests on your shoulders and is determined by your ability to execute and effectively lead a team that is hyper-focused on delivering a perfect experience for our customers.

Responsibilities:
Plans, directs, and is accountable for all warehouse operations including, deliveries, inventory, equipment, and systems
Fanatically drive improvements to key performance indicators (KPIs) such as: Order Picking Time, Order Dwell Time, Drive Time, Order Defect Rate, and Cost Per Order.
Accountable to drive the financial performance of the site by ensuring that budgeted productivity, labor, and other expenses are achieved
Responsible for ensuring compliance with goPuff and legal policies, procedures, and regulations for the warehouse by analyzing and interpreting reports
Implementing and monitoring Human Resource compliance, asset protection, safety controls, overseeing the safety of our people and products, operational and quality assurance reviews
Develop and implement action plans to improve performance, providing direction and guidance on executing Company programs and directing the management team in ensuring confidentiality of information, documentation and assigned records
Teach and train the site leadership in controlling expenses and labor to ensure expenses adhere to the budget and sales volume
Create and implement plans to improve the financial performance of the warehouse

Qualifications:
8+ years of managing and leadership experience, minimum of 5 years of experience with a fast-paced environment and leading a blended workforce of W2 and 1099 employees.
Retail, warehouse, logistics, military, restaurant or equivalent experience
Bachelor’s degree, preferable
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong skills with conflict resolution
Strong skills with team development and engagement
Ability to lead in an ever-changing environment
Proven track record of being a change agent with improving processes and efficiencies

JOB SUMMARY

The Compensation Analyst is responsible for the analysis, design, implementation and administration of competitive compensation programs that are innovative, compliant, cost effective and which support Covenant's compensation philosophy and strategic objectives.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

· Conducts internal and external market research, analyzes competitive position and market trends and makes recommendations for base salary structures, market adjustments and variable pay programs. Prepares written exhibits, summaries and recommendations for market adjustments and special pay programs (i.e. shift differentials, on-call rates, incentive programs.)

· Conducts job evaluations for new positions to determine appropriate salary grade. Evaluates and analyzes market data, determines FLSA status, and maintains appropriate documentation regarding the review. Reviews requests for evaluations of revised job descriptions and develops recommendations. Follows appropriate procedures for review and final approvals.

· Provide advice, guidance and training to corporate leaders, department managers, employees, and HR colleagues in the interpretation and administration of the organization's compensation programs and policies with a focus on service and designing programs that meet the business needs.

· Participates in salary surveys to collect and analyze information on the organization's competitive position. Gathers data per requirements, determines appropriate matches for assigned client areas, and submits information to the third-party survey administrator. Conducts analysis based on the survey results and keeps relevant information on salary evaluations.

· Acts as a project leader on compensation projects. Work may involve complex analysis of large data sets to provide comprehensive recommendations for all jobs across the organization including physicians and other clinical roles.

· Participate in significant Human Resources initiatives. Maintain collaborative team relationships with peers and colleagues.

· Supports and promotes the mission and values of Covenant Health and the Catholic Health Ministry.

· Other duties as consistent with this role.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education:

· Bachelor's degree required in Business or related field

· Certified Compensation Professional or on track to complete CCP certificate and/or other compensation course work a plus

Experience:

· Minimum of 5 years related experience in compensation analysis. Thorough knowledge of compensation policies and practices, as well as federal and state wage and hour law

· Experience with Physician and other Clinical compensation

· Experience working with an HRIS applications

Other Skills Required:

· Demonstrable commitment to the highest standard of ethical and professional conduct

· Excellent project management, analytical and financial modeling skills

· Demonstrated ability to design, communicate and implement compensation programs

· Attention to detail a must and proven ability to use discretion in dealing with confidential information

· Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills; skilled in facilitation, presentation and negotiation

· Advanced skills with Microsoft applications which may include Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and other web-based applications

*An equivalent combination of education and experience which provides proficiency in the areas of responsibility listed above may be substituted for the above education and experience requirements.

We are an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, disability status, gender, sexual orientation, ancestry, protected veteran status, national origin, genetic information or any other legally protected status.

The Role:

This role is an exciting opportunity to be a critical part of the talent engine fueling a high growth organization that is radically changing the biotech industry. The Associate Director, Human Resources Business Partner will be responsible for establishing and maintaining effective relationships in support of our G&A functions (including Commercial, Finance, Legal, HR, Business Development, Corporate Strategy, Corporate Affairs and Digital), while ensuring the efficient and effective delivery of key Human Resources projects and objectives. The primary purpose of this role is to partner with our VP, HRBP in support of the G&A & Commercial functions - ensuring they deliver against the business and people growth objectives of the company while also promoting a high-performance culture.

The Associate Director, HRBP will work collaboratively with the Human Resources team and other subject matter experts to align practices and initiatives with the Company’s strategic and operational goals. The anticipated time frame for this assignment is three months.

Here’s What You’ll Do:
Provide support to key functions and management in the areas of organizational effectiveness and development, talent acquisition, org & headcount planning, employee relations, coaching and talent management
Work cross-functionally and assist staff at many levels in optimizing the performance of their teams and resolving issues
Contribute to creating solutions in such areas as employment, employee communication, talent and career development, employee relations, compensation, benefits, and HRIS delivery
Support continued growth and infrastructure by helping to identify talent gaps and development areas across the G&A & Commercial functions and other areas, as the business grows
Provide day-to-day support to employees and managers regarding HR practices, HRIS systems, employee relations, development etc.
Ensure system workflows and communication are efficiently executed across key functions
Support VP, HRBP on key projects and initiatives as well as day-to-day tasks
Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:
Bachelor's degree and 8-10 years progressive Human Resources experience required, with a concentration in Talent Management or Talent Acquisition, preferred
Prior experience working in the technology, biotechnology and/or pharmaceutical industry is preferred
Experience leading or participating in enterprise wide initiatives in a growth environment is required, including skill in partnering with other members of the HR team
Ability to form strong partnerships and trust with employees regardless of level
Ability to manage multiple projects and collaborate effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional matrixed environment.
Ability to operate successfully and demonstrate agility in a fast-paced and ever-changing business environment
Ability to influence, coach ,and act as a thought partner with leaders in creating and driving talent strategies that fit business dynamics
Ability to ask questions, challenge the status quo and deploy system thinking in creating practical solutions
Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written).
Strong HR systems capability; advanced skills in MS Office and Power Point
A natural ability to be organized in how you think, communicate and conduct your work
A desire to be part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.
Here’s What We’ll Bring to the Table:
On-site subsidized cafeteria or catered lunches
Company-provided iPhone
Free parking, monthly subway pass or a subsidized commuter rail pass
Free annual corporate membership to Bluebikes
Highly competitive healthcare coverage including: medical offered through BCBS (HMO/PPO), dental, and vision offered through VSP
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical expenses and dependent care expenses
16 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for all new parents
16 weeks 100% paid family caregiver leave
20 weeks 100% paid medical leave
Eligible for “Moderna Month” (one month paid sabbatical after five years of service and eligible for additional one month paid sabbatical every 3 years thereafter)
Adoption assistance and discounts to local childcare centers, as well as access to care.com
401k (traditional and Roth offered) with 50% match on first 6% deferred. Match is vested immediately
A suite of Moderna paid insurance coverage, including: life insurance, short-term and long-term disability
Voluntary legal assistance plan
15 days’ vacation and 7 sick days per year, in addition to a discretionary winter shut down and 11 company paid holidays (includes 2 floating holidays)
About Moderna:

Moderna is advancing messenger RNA (mRNA) science to create a new class of transformative medicines for patients. mRNA medicines are designed to direct the body’s cells to produce intracellular, membrane or secreted proteins that can have a therapeutic or preventive benefit and have the potential to address a broad spectrum of diseases. The Company’s platform builds on continuous advances in basic and applied mRNA science, delivery technology and manufacturing, providing Moderna the capability to pursue in parallel a robust pipeline of new development candidates. Moderna is developing therapeutics and vaccines for infectious diseases, immuno-oncology, rare diseases, cardiovascular diseases, and autoimmune and inflammatory diseases, independently and with strategic collaborators.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Mass., Moderna currently has strategic alliances for development programs with AstraZeneca, Plc. and Merck, Inc., as well as the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), an agency of the U.S. Department of Defense, the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA), a division of the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response (ASPR) within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI). Moderna has been ranked in the top ten of Science’s list of top biopharma industry employers for the past five years. To learn more, visit www.modernatx.com.

Our Mission:


Deliver on the promise of mRNA science to create a new generation of transformative medicines for patients.

Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.

Moderna will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

#LI-DNI
Job Title: (Contract) Associate Director, HR Business Partner- G&A and Commercial

Job Description:
The International Institute of New England (IINE) is a non-profit organization that provides humanitarian relief, education, skills training, job placement, family reunification and pathways to citizenship for 2,000 immigrants and refugees each year. We work in Boston and Lowell, Massachusetts, and Manchester, New Hampshire.

IINE is the oldest and second largest resettlement agency in the region and has the largest Central American family reunification program in Greater Boston. More than 500 refugees and immigrants enroll in our education programs annually, and each year we connect hundreds of new Americans to jobs in New England companies.

A dynamic, forward-looking, smart and rapidly growing non-profit organization, we seek well-qualified, solutions-focused candidates who are experts in their respective fields. We are excited to share the career opportunity below and look forward to receiving your application!

Reports to: President & Chief Executive Officer

Supervises: Intern Program Manager, Digital Communications Manager, and Technology Consultant

Status: Exempt, Full Time

Start Date: July 6, 2020

Salary Range: $75K - $105K, contingent on experience

Overview:

The International Institute of New England (IINE) is a mission-driven, non-profit human services organization serving refugees and immigrants in Massachusetts and New Hampshire. We offer resettlement, education, career, and legal services to 2,500 people each year in three field offices, Boston and Lowell, Massachusetts, and Manchester, New Hampshire. We have a staff of 65 full- and part-time employees and approximately 90 on-call interpreters and drivers. IINE hosts 35-60 interns each year, and recruits dozens of volunteers to support our work.

We are looking for an energetic Director of Human Resources and Operations who will continue to facilitate and streamline operations across our three offices and support IINE staff to realize a healthy, respectful and supportive workplace. A member of IINEs senior leadership team, this position is responsible for the effective planning and implementation of IINEs recruiting, human resource operations, and personnel policies. S/he supports IINE directors and managers with employee relations, seeking guidance from outside counsel and resources as required. The successful candidate will enjoy making systems work and have sufficient expertise to manage personnel matters.

The Director of Human Resources and Operations works closely with the finance office to ensure that purchases are authorized and personnel and payroll information and records are up-to-date and accurate. With support from site-based Office Managers, the Director of Human Resources and Operations directs facility and vendor relations at each site, maintains inventory and staffing systems, creates and improves internal and external communications practices, monitors safety and evacuation plans, and ensures that centralized procedures are disseminated at the site level.

The Director of Human Resources and Operations is a team player committed to our mission of serving refugees and immigrants who focuses on finding operational solutions that allow staff to meet goals and objectives. S/he works to protect IINE from liability, ensures that IINE adheres to sound employment practices, and supports staff to ensure employee growth and retention. The Director regularly visits IINE field offices to develop stronger relations with employees and to address operational issues.

Qualifications:
Bachelors degree and 3+ years of administrative, business management or related experience required
Relevant educational experience accepted in place of professional experience
5+ years of related experience preferred
Juris Doctor degree preferred
High level of interpersonal poise and professionalism
Ability to interface, negotiate, and influence at all levels of the organization
Strong written communication skills, including the ability to draft policies and standard operating procedures.
Experience fielding and addressing concerns from employees
Strong relationship building skills with all levels of management; ability to maintain a high-level of confidentiality for both Leadership Team and the organization as a whole
Demonstrated superior organizational and time management skills; ability to multi-task and prioritize workload
Demonstrated experience designing and implementing the systems and processes outlined in the responsibilities for this role.
Experience developing and implementing diversity and inclusion initiatives
Understanding of employment law;
previous experience with employment law, including via legal counsel on retainer, a plus
Ability to professionally interact with diverse internal and external groups
Demonstrated experience utilizing and troubleshooting software and technology:
Advanced proficiency in all areas of Microsoft Office
Experience with Salesforce, Apricot, OfficeWise, ClearCompany or related databases preferred
Advanced understanding of phone, printer, and computer software/hardware essential
Bilingual/bi-cultural candidates are encouraged to apply
Must have access to a personal vehicle and have a current drivers license; the position involves regular travel to our locations in Lowell, Boston, and Manchester, New Hampshire
A demonstrated interest in the mission of the organization;
experience working with immigrants and refugees, or supporting others who serve those communities, preferred
Occasional lifting (up to 25 pounds), bending, pulling, and carrying.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

HUMAN RESOURCES

Recruiting & Onboarding
Maintain and continuously develop ClearCompany, IINEs recruitment platform
Design scorecards, interview assessments, email templates, etc.
Provide 1:1 support and group trainings on IINEs recruitment system
Design and implement quality control mechanisms to ensure hiring managers adhere to IINE policies and thoroughly and fairly vet candidates.
Coordinate offer letters and employment document processing
Process or delegate background checks, I-9 verifications, and Predictive Index requests
Ensure each new employee is provided quality onboarding by Manager.
Review benefits with each new eligible employee within 2 weeks of their start (preferably in person).
Direct the efforts of Office Managers tasked with setting up accounts, equipment, space, etc.
Communication:
Establish and host open office hours at each site on a biweekly basis
Communicate changes in IINE policies, staffing, and processes on a regular basis
Compensation & Payroll
Update Compensation Chart bimonthly
Develop IINE Salary Scale and ensure IINE salaries are competitive with the human services industry in Boston
Coordinate with accounting team to ensure timely processing of biweekly payroll
Address concerns and questions regarding timecards directly to managers
Administration & Documentation
Oversee all changes and terminations, coordinating with finance team and IINEs 3rd party payroll and benefits provider
Maintain updated digital personnel files for all employees, I-9s for all employees, and job descriptions for all positions. Ensure ADP profiles are also kept updated.
Manage the employee evaluation system, including monitoring 90-day and quarterly evaluations; improving the evaluation tools; training staff on evaluations; and ensuring that employee evaluations are placed in personnel files
Update the Employee Personnel Manual as requested and/or needed, coordinating updates with legal counsel to ensure that the manual is current with state and federal laws
Serve as the primary point of contact with the IINEs legal counsel, seeking guidance from counsel on employee relations and other matters
Prepare HR reports for Leadership and the Board of Directors as required
Employee Relations:
Serve as a resource for managers who request or require support with direct reports.
Advise on appropriate action and consult legal counsel when appropriate.
Meet with employees when necessary to hear about issues with supervisors, elevating any issue to the appropriate Director or Leadership Team member as appropriate
Conduct exit interviews, manage severance arrangements, and handle any post-employment communication with past employees.
Identify and explain any trends in exit interview data in reports to Leadership and the Board
Responsible for reviewing and explaining organizations policies and procedures with all employees annually and ensuring policies are reviewed with new employees upon their hire
Ensure legal compliance, including ADA compliance, by monitoring and implementing applicable federal and state requirements, conducting investigations, maintaining records, and representing the IINE in hearings and other legal proceedings
Process Unemployment notices from the States of NH and MA in a timely fashion
Benefits
Support the annual review of health, dental and other insurance options in conjunction with the CFO.
Coordinate the annual open enrollment period, including communicating changes in benefits and the enrollment timeline to employees.
Conduct an annual benefits survey to gauge staff satisfaction and understanding of benefits provided that plan year; deliver results of survey in person with CFO.
Return to each site to present options for coming plan year once identified.
Process any changes to an employees benefits with IINEs 3rd party payroll and benefits provider
Serve as the primary contact with the International Institutes workers compensation insurance agent for filing employee workers compensation claims
OPERATIONS
Ensure standardization of IINE network and individual site administrative processes including front office reception and management
Maintain the site drives, and assign user permissions based on employee role and responsibility.
Coordinate asset inventory records as well as on-and-off site storage
Identify and pursue opportunities to improve staff safety and experience; conduct an annual review of emergency processes and a safety survey of each site, update safety policies and procedures when needed and review with all staff on a bi-annual basis.
Identify ways to streamline and improve IINE operations, including new forms and processes.
Visit IINE field offices regularly to identify and address operational issues
TECHNOLOGY
Ensure appropriate maintenance of all technology
Anticipate future hardware, software, and technology system needs
Generate an annual procurement proposal that outlines recommended software and hardware purchases for the year, based on equipment age, and existing and anticipated positions
Support the Chief Financial Officer in selecting technology consultants and serve as the liaison to all technology support professionals.
ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT
Support the filing of all administrative permits, certificates, and licenses with the IINE Public Contracts Coordinator
Coordinate administrative and capital purchases in consultation with the Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
Coordinate the annual liability insurance process with insurance broker for CFO review
Coordinate office moves and space reorganizations
Maintain the Human Resources (hr@iine.org).
Track, monitor, and manage the progress of designated projects, action items, and strategies as directed by the President/CEO
CONTRACT AND VENDOR MANAGEMENT
Direct and assist the Office Managers to source and review vendors related to operations and facility management
Coordinate contract review, approval and signature process for operations, facility management, and consultants
Maintain all related filing systems
BOARD MANAGEMENT
Attend and prepare minutes from Board committee meetings as required
Attend quarterly Board meetings and prepare minutes for distribution
Applications:

Please note that a resume, cover letter, and writing sample are required as part of this application. Writing samples can be of any length and on any topic, but should convey your ability to organize your thoughts, as well communicate concisely and clearly. Please apply through iine.org/careers if you are having trouble submitting these documents.

Job Title: Associate Director, HR Business Partner- G&A and Commercial

Job Description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
The Sales Manager will lead a team to achieving financial objectives for both revenue and Signings in the Public and Federal Markets.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Lead sales team to meet and/or exceed monthly and quarterly quota objectives.
Drive double digit growth in MVS revenue and signings while also protecting IBM logo revenue/profit.
Responsible for recruitment, performance management, retention, skill-enhancement, training and succession planning. You will drive superior sales performance through inspirational sales coaching.
Understand the Public Market and how clients conduct business in this marketplace which includes State & Local, Healthcare, as well as Federal.
Grow and strengthen the relationships with Systems, and Global Technology Services Infrastructure Services into trusted partnerships driving cross brand opportunities.
Develop and maintain a system of continuous education for the team
Enhance sales performance through expanded use of digital and social processes and capabilities.
Demonstrate operational excellence through the disciplined management of key performance indicators, streamlining of inside sales processes and optimized resource deployment to improve pipeline yields and drive seller productivity.
Drive a client first culture with superior NPS outcomes and client references for TSS
Key Attributes:
Self starter & Servant leader
Articulate and confident in communication skills
Ability to build and manage a new team
Commitment to stay current with IBM's TSS offerings and industry/sector trends
Top notch communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to establish rapport at multiple levels of decision makers
Skilled in negotiation and problem solving
Experience managing sales cycles from opportunity identification to close
Strong understanding of technical concepts, data center technologies, and maintenance trends
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
At least 5 years experience in leading successful sales teams
Readiness to travel 50% travel annually.
Initiative to engage clients and teams to implement strategy and lead deals
Solutions oriented mindset and skilled in prospecting into new clients and new buyers.
Ability to train, mentor, and coach individuals at various stages of development
Understanding and knowledge Data Center technologies
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Self-motivated decision maker, taking initiative and recognizing opportunities to create and expand partnerships
Strong business analysis and strategy skills including business case development
Project management and leadership
About Business Unit
At Global Technology Services (GTS), we help our clients envision the future by offering end-to-end IT and technology support services, supported by an unmatched global delivery network. It's a unique blend of bold new ideas and client-first thinking. If you can restlessly reinvent yourself and solve problems in new ways, work on both technology and business projects, and ask, "What else is possible?" GTS is the place for you!

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when youre looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBMs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

The Department of Mental Health (DMH) is seeking qualified professionals for the position of Child/Adolescent Human Services Coordinator to promote services that are clinically appropriate, least restrictive and delivered close to home. The services are designed to be strength-based, recovery-oriented and culturally/linguistically competent.

The selected candidate advocates for client’s rights with all community providers, agencies, families, court systems, employers and significant others in order to ensure that client’s rights are recognized and respected.

Duties and Responsibilities (these are a general summary and not all inclusive):
Provides assistance to consumers in obtaining needed services to enable clients to live in the least restrictive setting possible.
Completes comprehensive client assessments to determine service needs.
Develops an Individual Service Plan (ISP) by including family members and providers in order to access and coordinate services to assure continuity of care.
Implements, monitors and modifies the ISP through periodic reviews with the client and providers in order to monitor progress and assure compliance.
Maintains each consumer record with all necessary documentation to ensure that a complete and up to date record of services is available at all times; generates statistical and billing information in a timely manner.
Establishes and maintains supportive relationships with clients and families/guardians through meetings and telephone contact to increase coping skills and to identify and secure acceptable services.
Develops and maintains working relationships with community and other state agencies, school departments and treatment providers in order to identify unmet needs and to effectively access a comprehensive range of services for consumers.
Assists clients to identify and overcome barriers to living with family members/guardians and accesses flexible, wrap around services when appropriate.
Advocates for the client by obtaining services and entitlements in addition to facilitating communication and negotiations with agencies.
Provides outreach to clients by telephone contact, home visits or letter for the purpose of ongoing assessment, supportive counseling and continuity of care.
Updates professional skills by attending in-service education programs to improve the quality of care to clients.
Assists clients in obtaining services by transporting clients when necessary to assure linkage to services and entitlements.
Contributes to the development of an ongoing resource file so that new community programs/services are identified and shared with team members.
Required Qualifications:
Demonstrated knowledge of psychosocial problems of those with mental/emotional disorders and the types and symptoms.
Knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of counseling.
Familiarity with the types of programs and services available to individuals living with mental illness.
General understanding of interviewing techniques.
Knowledge of methods of general report writing with the ability to assess case management process and results.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong and effective interpersonal skills, including the ability to listen well, relate to others and demonstrate sensitivity and respect for individuals.
Demonstrated commitment to serving a diverse population with cultural competence and sensitivity, as well as the ability to work with a wide range of constituencies with diplomacy and tact.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, and Excel.
Bachelors degree in a related field
Given the population served, bilingual or multilingual fluency.
Working Conditions:
This is a full-time, 37.5 hours per week position with Saturday and Sunday as days off.
This position travels to meet with clients and family members outside the office in various settings such as homes, hospitals, programs and other accessible community settings. Candidates will need access to a reliable motor vehicle for transportation.
DMH Mission Statement:

The Department of Mental Health assures and provides access to services and supports to meet the mental health needs of individuals of all ages, enabling them to live, work and participate in their communities. The Department establishes standards to ensure effective and culturally competent care to promote recovery. The Department sets policy, promotes self-determination, protects human rights and supports mental health training and research.

Total Compensation:

As an employee of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, you are offered a great career opportunity influencing a wide-spectrum of services to the diverse populations we serve - but it's more than a paycheck. The State's total compensation package features an outstanding set of employee benefits which you should consider towards your overall compensation, including:
75% state paid a medical insurance premium

Incentive-based Wellness Programs
Professional Development and Continuing Education opportunities
Qualified Employer for Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness Program

Education and license/certification information provided by the selected candidate(s) is subject to the Massachusetts Public Records Law and may be published on the Commonwealth’s website.

For questions regarding this requisition, please contact Carol Duggan at (978)851-7321 ext. 2395

Job Title: Human Services Coordinator I - CYF Case Manager

Job Description:
The Role:

This role is an exciting opportunity to be a critical part of the talent engine fueling a high growth organization that is radically changing the biotech industry. The Associate Director, Human Resources Business Partner will be responsible for establishing and maintaining effective relationships in support of our G&A functions (including Commercial, Finance, Legal, HR, Business Development, Corporate Strategy, Corporate Affairs and Digital), while ensuring the efficient and effective delivery of key Human Resources projects and objectives. The primary purpose of this role is to partner with our VP, HRBP in support of the G&A & Commercial functions - ensuring they deliver against the business and people growth objectives of the company while also promoting a high-performance culture.

The Associate Director, HRBP will work collaboratively with the Human Resources team and other subject matter experts to align practices and initiatives with the Company’s strategic and operational goals.

Here’s What You’ll Do:
Provide support to key functions and management in the areas of organizational effectiveness and development, talent acquisition, org & headcount planning, employee relations, coaching and talent management
Work cross-functionally and assist staff at many levels in optimizing the performance of their teams and resolving issues
Contribute to creating solutions in such areas as employment, employee communication, talent and career development, employee relations, compensation, benefits, and HRIS delivery
Support continued growth and infrastructure by helping to identify talent gaps and development areas across the G&A & Commercial functions and other areas, as the business grows
Provide day-to-day support to employees and managers regarding HR practices, HRIS systems, employee relations, development etc.
Ensure system workflows and communication are efficiently executed across key functions
Support VP, HRBP on key projects and initiatives as well as day-to-day tasks
Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:
Bachelor's degree and 8-10 years progressive Human Resources experience required, with a concentration in Talent Management or Talent Acquisition, preferred
Prior experience working in the technology, biotechnology and/or pharmaceutical industry is preferred
Experience leading or participating in enterprise wide initiatives in a growth environment is required, including skill in partnering with other members of the HR team
Ability to form strong partnerships and trust with employees regardless of level
Ability to manage multiple projects and collaborate effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional matrixed environment.
Ability to operate successfully and demonstrate agility in a fast-paced and ever-changing business environment
Ability to influence, coach ,and act as a thought partner with leaders in creating and driving talent strategies that fit business dynamics
Ability to ask questions, challenge the status quo and deploy system thinking in creating practical solutions
Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written).
Strong HR systems capability; advanced skills in MS Office and Power Point
A natural ability to be organized in how you think, communicate and conduct your work
A desire to be part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.
Here’s What We’ll Bring to the Table:
On-site subsidized cafeteria or catered lunches
Company-provided iPhone
Free parking, monthly subway pass or a subsidized commuter rail pass
Free annual corporate membership to Bluebikes
Highly competitive healthcare coverage including: medical offered through BCBS (HMO/PPO), dental, and vision offered through VSP
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical expenses and dependent care expenses
16 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for all new parents
16 weeks 100% paid family caregiver leave
20 weeks 100% paid medical leave
Eligible for “Moderna Month” (one month paid sabbatical after five years of service and eligible for additional one month paid sabbatical every 3 years thereafter)
Adoption assistance and discounts to local childcare centers, as well as access to care.com
401k (traditional and Roth offered) with 50% match on first 6% deferred. Match is vested immediately
A suite of Moderna paid insurance coverage, including: life insurance, short-term and long-term disability
Voluntary legal assistance plan
15 days’ vacation and 7 sick days per year, in addition to a discretionary winter shut down and 11 company paid holidays (includes 2 floating holidays)
About Moderna:

Moderna is advancing messenger RNA (mRNA) science to create a new class of transformative medicines for patients. mRNA medicines are designed to direct the body’s cells to produce intracellular, membrane or secreted proteins that can have a therapeutic or preventive benefit and have the potential to address a broad spectrum of diseases. The Company’s platform builds on continuous advances in basic and applied mRNA science, delivery technology and manufacturing, providing Moderna the capability to pursue in parallel a robust pipeline of new development candidates. Moderna is developing therapeutics and vaccines for infectious diseases, immuno-oncology, rare diseases, cardiovascular diseases, and autoimmune and inflammatory diseases, independently and with strategic collaborators.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Mass., Moderna currently has strategic alliances for development programs with AstraZeneca, Plc. and Merck, Inc., as well as the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), an agency of the U.S. Department of Defense, the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA), a division of the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response (ASPR) within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI). Moderna has been ranked in the top ten of Science’s list of top biopharma industry employers for the past five years. To learn more, visit www.modernatx.com.

Our Mission:


Deliver on the promise of mRNA science to create a new generation of transformative medicines for patients.

Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.

Moderna is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person’s race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Moderna will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

#LI-LW1
Job Title: Associate Director, HR Business Partner – G&A & Commercial

Job Description:
When you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll be part a growing organization that empowers our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. With our outstanding financial performance, leading market positions and the largest investment in innovation in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.

How will you make an impact?
We are excited to share that we have multiple roles reporting into a specific business in various locations. This role is integral to our commitment to advance and accelerate diversity and inclusion within our workplace, and specifically within the group assigned. Working within the robust matrix, this Director will ensure our workplace is representative of the communities and customers we serve and that the environment is inclusive for all. The incumbent must lead through influence not hierarchical power to drive cultural and behavior change and advancement of an inclusive culture. This role requires excellent change management skills and the ability to work effectively at all levels of the organization. The HR Director of Diversity and Inclusion will be the business group's subject matter expert and work collaboratively with the D&I CoE. Working with the business and HR broadly they will assess, determine and implement detailed and cohesive actions plan that aligns with the D&I CoE's strategic plans to yield measurable progress in specific workstreams, including but not limited to: recruiting and placement, ERG maximization, targeted development plans, retention, management cultural accountability, etc. The leader will have the responsibility to drive inclusion systematically across the business group, including deeper diagnostics, hypothesis creation and validation and defining key actions to drive appropriate change in support of our corporate goals.

What will you do?
Develops and delivers tailored best in class colleague inclusion and diversity roadmap that aligns with the D&I CoE's strategic plan and that positively and measurably affects the culture, team, and colleague experience in support of the business group's and company's strategic business goals.
Energizes and engages cross-functional and matrixed teams to achieve our vision, demonstrating a high-level of emotional intelligence, openness to change, and the willingness to merge ideas to bring forward the best solutions.
Provides expertise, thought leadership and best practices to D&I issues and opportunities, while operating as an extension of the D&I CoE.
Deliver a granular and comprehensive delivery plan for key priorities and interventions including increasing diversity representation within the leadership pipeline and delivering world class inclusion campaigns that deliver measurable progress on Diversity and Inclusion.
Act as the D&I subject matter expert, ensuring knowledge is relevant and up to date across multiple diversity and inclusion strands.
Work in collaboration with executive leaders, HR leadership, talent acquisition, talent management and head of D&I and others on identifying and minimizing the impact of any potential systematic barriers and enablers of diversity.
Work in partnership with the communications lead to ensure the communications of key messages and milestones that are aligned to the wider D&I strategic plan and roadmap.
How will you get here?
Bachelor's degree required
8-10 years of progressively responsible experience in Human Resources at a global organization, delivering inclusion, diversity or HR projects.
Ability to develop, analyze, and interpret data to drive systematic change and improvements
Strong understanding of the talent process and succession practices.
Proven ability to interact with multiple levels of leadership both internally and externally, and influence peers and senior management.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Strong communication skills- written and verbal; ability to present to and facilitate audiences at all levels.
Ability to travel as required for appropriate key meetings and forums (around 10% of the time).
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

Company description:

At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Job summary:

The Red Hat North America (NA) People (HR) team is looking for an Associate HR Manager to join our growing Delivery team in Westford, MA. Red Hat office location is ideal, but the role is also open to any remote U.S. locations in general. In this role, you will report to the NA people delivery manager and partner with several Engineering teams within the Products and Technologies (PnT) team, aligning our HR strategy and programs with their business needs. You will have the opportunity to actively consult with leaders and associates within the Linux Engineering and Service Delivery teams with a focus on performance and development, leadership development, goal planning and alignment, diversity and inclusion, change management and communication, total rewards and recognition, and engagement and retention strategies. As an Associate HR Manager, you will work according to the priorities of the talent strategy set by your customer management teams and collaborate with our global People team centers of excellence (CoEs). Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business.

Primary job responsibilities:
Identify, integrate, and deliver effective HR services around performance and development, leadership development, goal planning and alignment, diversity and inclusion total rewards strategy, and engagement and retention initiatives
Connect effective people team solutions to the key talent challenges the business is trying to solve
Message the value and business impact of HR programs to leader and associate populations
Consult and coach customers around our total rewards and talent management philosophies and their application to guide quality decisions
Build solid relationships with CoE partners to most effectively consult around executing key programs within the business
Augment day-to-day generalist support of several customer groups
Use internal tools and other information sources to identify business trends and ensure that appropriate CoE solutions are in place to support
Required skills:
5-8 years of previous experience directly supporting engineering organizations as an HR generalist or in a CoE, business process, or HR support function capacity
Persuasive communicator
Solid presentation skills
Good problem-solver
Ability to inspire decision-making
Team-first orientation
Motivation and perseverance
Demonstrable business insight
Ability to identify and prioritize what’s essential
Comfortable in a fast-paced, changing environment
Comfortable building solid relationships in a fully remote environment
Desire to build your footprint and shape a key role as part of a fun, dynamic team

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of June 30, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.9 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Kaman Automation, a business unit of Kaman Distribution, is a nationally recognized leader in the high-tech motion control and automation industry. As a distributor, we have access to a wide variety of products and technologies. Our distributor division supports the industry's top manufacturers. For most of these product lines, we are their largest distributor. With more than 50 years of experience in the motion control field, our staff consists of highly qualified people with extensive knowledge of the motion control industry. We stay up to date with current technology to provide you with quality, state-of-the-art products with the technical support to back them.
We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Director, Human Resources to join our team in Boston, MA (branch located in Franklin, MA)
Reporting to the Vice President of Kaman Automation, the Human Resources Director plans, organizes, directs and controls the activities of the Human Resources functions in order to ensure effective programs and compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This position is responsible for implementing strategic plans, supporting margin and profitability goals. They will work closely with the business leaders and will have a dotted-line reporting relationship to the Vice President of Human Resources, Kaman Distribution Group.

Participates on Business Segment Team to assist in the implementation of the strategic plan. Implements goals and objectives in Human Resources and provides leadership to an organization of 420 employees, 20 locations across the US and $225 Million in sales.
Provides leadership to Human Resources to ensure a high level of productivity, quality and customer service. Ensures teamwork, communicates information and provides feedback to direct reports. Determines performance expectations, evaluates performance and provides coaching and development opportunities.
Formulates Human Resources business plans, goals, objectives and policies. Establishes and enforces organization standards.
Oversees the development and administration of: Organizational development, employee relations, recruitment and retention, training and professional development, performance management, diversity, affirmative action plan, compliance and reporting and benefits administration.
Provides leadership and consulting support to business leaders on goal setting, policy development and strategic implementation in support of achieving objectives and business growth.
Implements and improves Lean processes to ensure increased efficiencies and effectiveness.
Provides a high level of service to all internal and external customers. Ensures that a positive teamwork environment is maintained in Human Resources.
Accountable for organizing, developing, and promoting programs to ensure that operations and activities meet and exceed regulatory requirements, maintain programs to promote and maintain a safe and healthy workplace.
Play an active role in promoting the company’s culture and values and be perceived as a trusted resource to the business leaders.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Management; MBA or professional certification preferred.
Experience:
Minimum of 10 years in a leadership position in Human Resources
Excellent generalist experience, with a proven track record of managing Human Resources programs in a business of comparable size and complexity
Strong proficiency in developing and implementing Human Resources programs, policies and procedures, with a working knowledge of appropriate laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to the business
Demonstrated experience in developing and executing effective programs for performance management, employee development, success planning & talent management, and recruiting, working with a diverse employee base
Capable understanding of the role of Human Resources leadership in a non-union environment
Prior experience in distribution a plus
Working knowledge of Lean process and involvement in continuous programs
Skills and Abilities:
The ability to operate within an environment where change happens frequently and adapting to changes in circumstances is important for success.
Strategic thinker, able to drive decision-making
Self-aware leader, highly sensitive to key elements affecting culture, employee morale, functional performance and the business’s ability to attain its overall objectives
Experience working in a matrix environment and a demonstrated ability to inform and provide leadership to ancillary functional areas.
Superior interpersonal skills; ability to work effectively with all levels, backgrounds, and functions.
Strong verbal and written communication skills; must be able to make effective presentations, to negotiate, to listen and to influence.
Organized, focused on the priorities of the business, excellent problem solving skills, results oriented.
Well-developed managerial style, with a strong emphasis on team-building and teamwork.
Kaman Distribution Group is comprised of three business units: Kaman Automation, Kaman Fluid Power, and Kaman Industrial Technologies. We offer more than four million items including bearings, mechanical power transmission, electrical and automation, material handling, motion control, fluid power and MRO supplies to customers in virtually every industry. Additionally, we provide engineering, design and support for automation, electrical, linear, hydraulic and pneumatic systems as well as belting and rubber fabrication, customized mechanical services, hose assemblies, repair, fluid analysis and motor management. Offering products and solutions from more than 250 locations, our people are the foundation of our success. We recognize that our ability to sustain our competitive advantage rests among our talent.

Company Name: NETSCOUT


Seeking a Senior Human Resources Business Partner based in Westford, MA

Description:

NETSCOUT SYSTEMS, INC. (NASDAQ: NTCT) is a market leader in real-time service assurance and cybersecurity solutions for today’s most demanding service provider, enterprise and government networks. We collect, correlate, organize, and analyze traffic data from all corners of your environment. Headquartered in Westford, Massachusetts, NetScout has approximately 2,500 employees and offices across the globe. NetScout serves the Global 5000 enterprise community as well as government agencies and telecommunications service providers.

Position Summary:

We are currently searching for a Senior Human Resources Business Partner based in Westford, MA to support the U.S. based Sales organization. Reporting to the Director Human Resources, Sales, the Senior HR Business Partner (HRBP) serves as a consultant to their client group, communicating needs proactively with our HR department and business management, to develop integrated solutions. The position formulates partnerships across the HR function to deliver value-added service to management and employees that reflects the business objectives of the organization.

Responsibilities:
Partner with our Domestic Sales organization leaders, employees and deliver HR support across multiple functions.
Act as the HR partner to provide coaching, counsel on HR policy, direction and support to our remote, home office-based Sales employees located in our domestic regions.
Works closely with management and employees to improve working relationships, engagement and retention
Partner with Talent Acquisition to support all aspects of the recruitment process.
Assists with coordination and facilitation of cyclical HR initiatives such as workforce planning, performance reviews and compensation planning.
Works closely with the HR Director to improve the overall effectiveness of the Sales Business Unit by building a talent and performance management culture that supports strategic business goals and links human capital to performance.
Partner with leaders to advise, counsel, and provide feedback to managers and employees on performance management, including the development and delivery of Performance Improvement Plans.
Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Partners with the legal department as needed/required.
Supports the rollout and execution of corporate HR programs and initiatives, participates in cross functional project teams.
Partners with Regional HR Colleagues and Corporate Centers of Expertise to provide best in class HR services to client groups.
Manage employee separations; conduct exit interviews; follow up on feedback as appropriate, track results and analyzes data.
Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough and objective investigations.

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, or related field of study
